strIntroduction: Japanese Special Photo Studio Angelle is a photo studio where you can get your portfolio created, one with you looking at your very best in a beautiful Japanese traditional Oiran's kimono. Being a little different from those of Maikos (apprentice geishas), the kimonos of Oiran are more magnificent and sexy. The Oirab that Angelle proposes are decked out in expensive magnificent uchikake (a traditional long outer kimono) like that of a bride. Her hairstyle is not limited to the traditional ones, but comes in many different kinds, to which original creations of floral decorations are added. The result is nothing less than gorgeous. The makeup is also in vivid colors to enhance the costume and the photo shoot. Every customer will be transformed into a fashion model or a movie star. Her photograph will be a dramatic one, the kind that no regular photo studio is capable of achieving because she will be installed in a three-dimensional set like that for a scene in a movie. The makeup of a Maiko is one with a white foundation with red as the keynote. Its finish emphasizes elegance. In Kyoto, the Maiko culture is deeply rooted, boasting a long history, so in order to transform into a Maiko, some restrictions apply. The photo shoot will be done with natural lighting in which the white foundation manifests itself in such a way that a soft natural harmonious effect is achieved in the photograph. The transformation into a Oiran at Angelle is not limited in form. Indeed the new kimono styles for the transformation are limitless in possibilities for realizing the wishes of the customers. Let us turn you into an Oiran! What to bring: - Your own cosmetics. We provide the cosmetics for the Oiran experience but not for afterwards.
strTitle: Get a photo session dressed in Japanese Oiran kimono, Kyoto

strIntroduction: This distillery came about as a collaboration between Kirin Brewery, Joseph E Seagram and Sons and Chivas Brothers in 1972. It is one of the rare distilleries in the world to produce four different types of whiskies: one malt and three grains distilled in various types of stills, resulting in distinct flavors and bodies. Tours: Guided tours of around 70-minutes including observation of whole production process, a short screening introducing the facilities, and whisky tasting of up to 2 glasses.
strTitle: Kirin Fuji Gotemba Whisky Distillery Tour & Tasting

strIntroduction: This temple is one of the most historic temples in Kyoto, having been established in 1590. The temple played a key role in the spread of Japanese Zen Buddhism in the early twentieth century. The American-educated abbot will lead you in the basics of Zen meditation, followed by a tour of the temple. You will learn how Buddhism has influenced Japanese culture, as well as practice acquiring the proper frame of mind through meditation. This experience will help you understand the Japanese mind more. If you are tired of your trip and want to refresh your mind, this would be the best activity. Photos by: http://www.flickr.com/photos/weirdo513/3329598076/ http://www.flickr.com/photos/rocketlass/3349248494/ http://www.flickr.com/photos/rocketlass/3349246458/ http://www.flickr.com/photos/neil_weightman/3500924033/ http://www.flickr.com/photos/mvasaly/4430483409/
strTitle: Join Zen Meditation Class in Kyoto

strIntroduction: Dyeing began as a fashion for the samurai families in the Muromachi era and developed in the Edo era. It has such a long history and is a popular Japanese tradition. Variations expanded by combining many patterns, and many people came to enjoy the clothing culture called kimono. As clothing for Japanese people shifted to Western style, the number of dye craftsmen in its growing center located in "Ochiai, Shinjuku" gradually decreased. There are approximately 10 companies at present. However, they have awesome techniques and spirits for Edo-style dyeing, and have been taking on new challenges while protecting the tradition. Edo dyeing is a world-class technique. Various goods have been developed, including not only kimono but also small articles and interiors. Edo dyeing has expanded into a new market as a material that can be dispatched to the world. You can experience dyeing cloth at Futaba-en, Tokyo. It opens every Wednesday and Saturday from 13:00 and takes about 90 minutes. Reservation: 3 working days prior.
strTitle: Experience dyeing textile at Futaba-en, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Kyoto's Gion and Higashiyama districts are well-known as the Mecca of geisha art in Japan. Visitors strolling the narrow streets of the neighbourhood at evening time have the chance to spot a geiko (Kyoto geisha) or a maiko (apprentice) entering one of the numerous traditional-style Japanese restaurants or "ochaya" tea houses. Every night there is a private dinner or a banquet for small groups who have been granted exclusive access to the restaurants that are not usually open to the general public. Inside the guests are served an authentic Japanese-style kaiseki multi-dish dinner and are entertained by one or more geisha artists in the most authentic manner. All of this is usually a private and closed-doors event that is offered only to special guests. Tourists typically visit one of the popular public facilities in Gion to watch a maiko stage show, but this in no way resembles the authentic experience of dining in an "ochaya" in the company of a well-trained maiko. By booking this activity you will have the chance to enter private Japanese-style restaurants that are not generally open to everyone. You will be accompanied by a genuine Kyoto geiko and a local interpreter, who has special access to the "ochaya", and will spend about 3 hours in a wonderful and authentic Japanese setting. The maiko artist will casually chat with you, serve you drinks, and even play easy games with you or show you some of her dancing abilities. You will be served a gorgeous Japanese-style dinner with top-quality sake. Depending on the season, this activity may include also a visit to a temple to see the night illuminations or to a Japanese garden that is not usually open to public. Your guide will inform you about the seasonal activities when you book. Please note that the maiko does not speak English fluently and you will have a guide-interpreter. Depending on the restaurant, you may be in a private room or in a room with other guests. The authenticity of this experience is guaranteed!
strTitle: Book an exclusive private dinner with a maiko in Kyoto

strIntroduction: - - - - Tour Overview - - - - Take a fascinating deep dive into Japanese seafood cuisine during this 3-hour combination walking tour of Tsukiji Fish Market and cooking class where you can learn to prepare traditional style washoku food items like sushi and a Japanese omelet. - - - - What to Expect - - - - - *Tsukiji Fish Market* Meet up with your guide in the morning in front of Tsukiji Honganji Temple, located just outside the famous seafood market. Then, step inside this temple to all things seafood for an in-depth shopping session including plenty of time for photography and exploration. As you wander the aisles of this colorful and chaotic market, you’ll observe everything from giant tuna to sea urchins to octopus arranged for sale. *Japanese Washoku Making Class* Once you’ve had your fill of seafood, proceed with your guide to the gourmet cooking studio of one of Asia’s largest culinary schools, boasting more than 150 studios throughout the region. Following the instruction of an experienced cooking teacher, you’ll learn to prepare two washoku recipes, a style of Japanese cuisine emphasizing traditional and homemade techniques. This typically includes a sushi roll along with a Japanese style omelet called Tamagoyaki plus side dishes. *Sushi Roll Lunch* Finish your session by digging into your tasty creations for lunch, enjoying your meal accompanied by your choice of wine, plum sake, or soft drinks. You’ll leave with a full stomach and a newfound appreciation for the wondrous world of Japanese cuisine and its top-notch ingredients. - - - Tour Schedule - - - 9:20 Meet up at Tsukiji Honganji Temple 9:30 Group walk at the Tsukiji Market 11:00 Cooking class starts 12:00 Tour ends after enjoying your creation for lunch! 12:30 Tour ends - - - Cooking Menu - - - Rolled-Sushi, Japanese egg omelet + one more dish with Japanese soup.
strTitle: 18% OFF Tsukiji Fish Market Tour &Rolled Sushi Cooking Class

strIntroduction: In this experience, you'll get to participate in Zen zazen (seated meditation) to calm your mind at the temple in Komazawa. By participating zen session, you will improve not only your concentration, but you'll also leave with both your mind and body feeling refreshed. You'll also get to experience sounds that you normally can't hear like the songs of birds. Come join me in practicing zazen!
strTitle: Enjoy Zen meditation Experience in Tokyo

strIntroduction: This is an unbelievable 1-day bus tour that takes you to: - see Mt Fuji and drive up to the 5th Station at 2,300 meters above sea level - experience the authentic Japanese hot spring bathing ritual at Lake Yamanaka Onsen - shop with discounts at the Gotemba Premium Outlets Tour details: Your day starts at 9 am when you meet your guide at Shinjuku. Ride on a comfortable private coach towards Mt Fuji. It is 100km (60 miles) to the Gotemba 5th Station, a famous viewing area high on the slopes. Mt Fuji, Japan’s highest peak, looms overhead, at 3,776 meters (12,389 feet). You can walk around and admire the incredible views across the plains and up high towards the summit. Your guide explains the history and significance of this revered mountain. It has inspired many poets, painters and pilgrims over the centuries. More than 200,000 climbers start their ascent here, from this 5th station, to the summit every year. The elevation can be chilly even in summer, it is best to bring a sweater of light jacket. On some days in winter and spring, the road might be to icy to reach the 5th station itself. On these days, we will drive as high as it is allowed. The crisp mountain air will have made you hungry! Close to the mountain you will sample a typical Japanese lunch, included in your program. After lunch, you’ll head for nearby Lake Yamanaka, an area famous for the healing powers of its hot spring waters. This is the perfect spot to get naked and feel the sensation of Japanese indoor and outdoor baths yourself. Now you are all refreshed it is time to get some serious shopping done! The Gotemba Premium Outlets are the largest outlet shopping venue in Japan. Included are discount coupons, and you can shop around for about 2 hours. There is a wide range of national and international brands available, with Mt Fuji ever-present in the background. At the end of the day, you will be dropped of at Shinjuku Station in Tokyo again. Itinerary: 08.50 am Meet your guide near Shinjuku Station (the exact departure spot will be provided after you book) Bring your reservation confirmation sheet to show to the guide. 09.00 am Bus departs for Mt. Fuji (about 120 min) Visit Gotemba Mount Fuji 5th Station and spend around 30 minutes to admire the views. 12:40 - 13:40 Drive to the ninja park Oshino-mura (50 min) and enjoy your Japanese-style lunch (optional). 14:00 - 15:00 At Lake Yamanaka Onsen (60 min) where you enjoy a traditional soak in the hot spring waters. 15:40 - 17:40 Shop at the Gotemba Premium Outlets (120 min). the Gotemba Premium Outlets are the largest outlet shopping center in Japan. Enjoy shopping with Mt. Fuji in the background at this huge outlet mall. 19:10 - 19:40 Return at Shinjuku station. Your tour ends upon arrival near the West Exit of Shinjuku Station. This tour is available every Monday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday. Not available during the winter season. ※Vegetarian meal Some animal products may be used as a soup stock for the vegetarian meal. Alcohol and mirin (sweet sake) can also be used for all types of meals. If you cannot eat these products, please choose the "without lunch" option.
strTitle: Visit Mt Fuji and Gotemba Premium Outlets in a day tour!

strIntroduction: Ikebana may seem like a simple style of flower arrangement, but in reality, it's an authentic Japanese art through which locals appreciate the beauty of simplicity. Everything is taken into consideration to the smallest detail, including the size and shape of the flowers, trunks, leaves and branches. Ikebana is often falsely regarded as an art form reserved for women, however, traditionally ikebana used to be a required "mannerism" for well-educated man. Since you came all this way to visit a "strange" island, it would be a waste NOT to experience our genuinely unique culture! <What you experience> 1. In this course you will first be introduced to essential knowledge about ikebana and the history of its development. 2. After listening to the instruction, you'll learn the basic concepts of ikebana, allowing you to grasp an image for your own work. 3. And then it`s finally your turn: Try to create an ikebana art work by your self! Don't worry, we'll give you a hand when you need it. <Availability> Monday, Wednesday, Friday 10:00am (75-90 min) Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday 4:00pm (75-90in)
strTitle: Experience the art of Ikebana in Gion, Kyoto

strIntroduction: Usually we call this sword cutting technique "tate", and it's a special technique that only selected people can learn, for example stage and film actors. The technique includes a beautiful acting expression, posture, gestures, etiquette, attentiveness, and caring attitude, as well as the discipline of the mind. The moral principle behind this is what we call "dou". Combined with "tate", we can say that this technique is is "tate-dou" and you will learn more about the traditional culture of Japan through the "tate-dou". The program for this activity includes: - Samurai experience A professional instructor will kindly teach you how to be a samurai! Dress up in a kimono/ninja costume/samurai armor and learn how to hold the katana (sword) and cut down! In the end, everyone will become a leading actor in the show and will take part in a scene together.
strTitle: Learn the sword (katana) technique of Samurai and Ninja

strIntroduction: Enjoy the distinctive atmosphere and learn through the tea ceremony that represents Japan's ultimate hospitality (“Omotenashi spirit”). In a tea ceremony, there is a phrase “Chazen ichimi”. This means “Cha” (tea ceremony) has originated from "Zen". Tea ceremony brings comfort to your heart through facing each other. Zen settles down your heart through facing with yourself. Also, tea ceremony is said to represent the ultimate hospitality (“Omotenashi”). For making a one bowl of Macha, the tea master thinks about the visitors, and select the appropriate flowers and seasonal sweets for the hospitality (“Omotenashi”). Through tea ceremony experience, you can enjoy Japanese traditional culture, the heart of Japanese people, and Japan’s beauty. Our tea room would like to introduce you the wonderful Japanese hospitality, traditional culture, and Matcha green tea. Of course, we will show you a very simple ceremony that can be understood by beginners. We really hope that you will enjoy this Japanese experience with us! Hours of Opreation: from 9:00 – 21:00 9:00 / 10:00 / 11:00 / 12:00 13:00 / 14:00 / 15:00 / 16:00 17:00 / 18:00 / 19:00 / 20:00
strTitle: Enjoy an Elegant Tea Ceremony Experience in Ginza, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Let's run together in the center of Tokyo to see Ginza, Tsukiji and Nippon bridge! The run will cover about 12-13 km, and we will have a 2 hour break in between. We will run past Tokyo station, rivers, harbors, Shinto shrines, shopping streets and experience the vibrant charm of Tokyo's downtown. Everybody, from tourists visiting Tokyo for the first time to people living and working in Tokyo, is welcomed to join us on this run! Let's experience running through the center of Tokyo, full of interesting discoveries and surprises!
strTitle: Let's Go Running in the Center of Tokyo, Ginza & Tsukiji!

strIntroduction: Come hangout around Akihabara and Nakano, and visit many anime shops with me! I'll take you to the best anime stores for premium, maniac, and second-hand products to help you find the anime goods you're looking for! Schedule: 10am: Pickup at the train station near your accommodation in downtown Tokyo. We will decide on lunch and have lunch together. 12pm: Tour Akihabara or Nakano. We will visit different anime stores based on your interests and preferences. 3pm: Sightseeing and shopping at Takeshita Street in Harajuku. There are many dessert shops so we can enjoy some sweets if you'd like. 6pm: Visit the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building Observatory. We will enjoy the beautiful view of Tokyo at night.
strTitle: Hangout and Discover Anime Places in Tokyo in One Day

strIntroduction: This is a one day tour around Enoshima Island's highlights! Lunch at Seafood restaurant: Enoshima has specific seafood meals. You can enjoy them for lunch. Also on the Benten street, you can get snacks and souvenirs. Enoshima Shrine: Everything in the shrine has a special meaning. Our guide will tell you the story of legend and history about Enoshima. Enoshima Sea Candle tower (Observatory): The observatory is not so high, but the view is sweeping. Enoshima is surrounded by the ocean, so nothing obstructs your view. Enoshima Ryugu (Dragon): The dragon has close relations with the origin of Enoshima. What does the dragon mean? Why do people worship the dragon? Enoshima Iwaya Caves: They are not just caves. There are many attractions and you will be given a small Japanese lantern to go into the dark caves. If you go down the caves, you will surely find something. Can you guess what you will see?
strTitle: Find many attractions in Enoshima: Ocean, History, Seafood!

strIntroduction: Five reasons to choose Kyoto Fun's Cycling Tour 1. Bicycle is by far the best way to get around Kyoto’s crowded streets. Kyoto has a great geography for two wheels. Why wait for crowded buses or be stuck in traffic with an expensive taxi when you have the freedom to move around at will like the locals do. 2. We take you on scenic routes which are chosen with your safety in mind. Riding a bike alone you might get lost or end up on very narrow streets. We know the best way to get around and give you tips on staying safe. We also know quiet side streets with lots of character and charm. 3.We tell you stories of the city’s past and give you background knowledge along the way. Learn about the world of the shogun and samurai, the geisha house and even get a background on the shinto and buddhist beliefs. Learning about the cultural legacy of old Kyoto is a great insight to Japanese customs and culture. 4. You can choose to join a small group of six max or a private experience. With a maximum of six riders we can be sure to get around more easily and give everyone a more intimate experience. Or for the ultimate in flexibility and customisation choose a private experience and we will go out of our way to take any special requests that you have on board. 5.We don’t just give you a history lesson, we focus on having a fun enjoyable day. Lots of tours offer guides that can rattle off facts figures and dates but are always on a tight time frame. We look at travel a little different. So, if you want a fun day out on the bikes and enjoy the journey as much as the destination, choose this experience and I am sure you will be pleased. Choose from one of three courses or help plan the day with your guide on a private experience. Bike Tour of the West Side of Kyoto Duration: 5-6 hrs Distance: 20 km Difficulty: Moderate Kinkakuji the "Golden Pavilion" → Genko-An a hidden gem → Kitano-tenmangu an ancient shrine → Kamishichiken Geisha District We make our way across town to Kinkakuji the Golden Pavillion. This is one of the most spectacular sights in Kyoto and a UNESCO World Heritage site with lush gardens and plenty to take in. Next up is a quiet temple off the beaten path called Genko-An. This zen temple has a unique history and is a nice quiet place to look at the beautiful gardens through the two windows, one circular and one square.These represent two views of the world, through the lens of confusion or one of enlightenment. On the way out you can gaze up to the ceiling panels which are made from the blood stained floorboards of a famous castle, put in place to commemorate the samurai who died in battle on that fateful day. After Genko-An we visit one of the most famous shrines in Kyoto, Kitano-tenmangu. This shrine is dedicated to a statesman and scholar who became deified as a god of thunder after his banishment from Kyoto and vengeful return as an angry spirit after death. This place is remarkable for it's many old wooden structures set amongst thousands of plum trees. It is also a place where students pray for good exam results. After that we visit the Kamishichiken Geisha District nearby for a look at the smallest and quietest geisha area. Here we can soak up the classic atmosphere and maybe even see a geisha on her way to work. This tour covers a lot of ground in a day but we can see a lot of the city as we roll past on our bikes. Bike Tour of the South Side of Kyoto Duration: 5-6 hrs Distance: 10 km Difficulty: Easy Sanjusangendo the 1001 kannon statues → Tofukuji a zen garden → Fushimi Inari the tunnel of red gates → Miyagawa cho geisha district Starting at the magical temple Sanjusangendo, here you have an opportunity to see 1001 kannon statues which were carved way back in 12th and 13th century Japan. This is a place with a lot of history and a real mind blowing experience to wander past these statues made with amazing skill. Then it's on to discover a masterpiece of zen gardening at Tofukuji. This place will take your breath away. There are several gardens to discover with each having a different style. Most impressive is the deep gully spanned by a bridge with dozens of maple trees lining the way. After that we head to Fushimi Inari, possibly one of the most famous and definitely most photographed places in Kyoto. Enjoy a stroll amongst the thousands of red torii gates and feel the magical energy of the place. This is also a place to pray for a good harvest or success in business so bring a few coins to drop in the prayer box and we will show you how to make a wish in the shinto way. Then we head back to the city through Gion and discover quaint neighbourhoods in a special part of Kyoto. Here we also visit the geisha district of Miyagawa cho and enjoy a little look in on the ways of the traditional entertainers in Kyoto. We may even be lucky enough to spot some Geisha or their apprentice Maiko on the way to their next appointment. Bike Tour of the East Side of Kyoto Duration: 5-6 hrs Distance: 10 km Difficulty: Easy Heian Shrine's spectacular garden → Ginkakuji the "Silver" Pavilion → the Path of Philosophy → Nanzen-ji temple grounds → Gion District Starting at Heian Shrine you get a fantastic introduction to Japanese garden design at the sprawling garden of Heian Shrine. This a a real gem as it's usually not crowded at all so you can stroll the gardens at leisure while we talk about the traditional customs of the old capital. From here it is a short trip to Ginkakuji which has one of the most relaxing and classic Japanese style gardens from the days when the tea ceremony had a huge influence on the culture of Japan. This was a retirement villa for a famous shogun and grandson of the shogun who built the Golden Pavilion across town. Here you can see buildings which are over 500 years old and a masterful display of gardening skill. From there a trip down the Path of Philosophy which is one of the most pleasant paths in Kyoto. Hugging the hills there is an abundance of nature and plenty of little shops and cafes along the route. This takes us to Nanzen Ji temple, one of the great temples of the Zen faith. The grounds here are spectacular and we can even see a Romanesque aqueduct running through the nature filled site. Then it's on to two of the famous streets in Gion called Hanimikoji and Shirakawa Dori. Here you can soak up the atmosphere and maybe even spot a geisha running off to an appointment. One this pleasant day you can see lots of nature, beautiful gardens and get a taste of zen.
strTitle: Kyoto Fun: Cycling Tour

strIntroduction: Kagurazaka is a famous shopping and food district in Tokyo. It is lively during the day and night and many people visit here to experience the culture of Japan. It is easily accessible from Iidabashi Station. During the Edo Period, Kagurazaka was located just outside the Edo Castle and was vibrant with geisha houses and restaurants. There are some geisha houses that still remain in the streets of Kagurazaka to this day. In this tour, you will walk around Kagurazaka with an English speaking guide and get to become an expert about this neighborhood! Here is a brief itinerary of the tour: -Meet at Iidabashi Station -Walk along Kagurazaka-dori and see the many restaurants, shops and cafes! -Visit Kagurazaka Wakamiya Hachiman Jinja, a shrine that was built by Yoritomo Minamoto, the first shogun of the Kamakura Shogunate of Japan. -Visit Akagi Jinja, a modernized shrine produced by a famous architect called Kengo Kuma. -Visit Sodesurizaka, "Sodesuri" means rubbing against eachother's sleeve, which represents how narrow the road is. -Visit Zenkoku-ji, the birthplace of the temple festival. -Walk around Hyogo Yokocho, where the stone pavements brings the scenery of old Tokyo. -Visit Tsukudo Hachiman Jinja, which has the oldest stone torii gate in this ward. -Visit Tokyo Daijingu Shrine -End of tour at Iidabashi Station There are many more places you could be visiting in this tour: -Ushigome Mitsuke & Ushigomebashi -Atamiyu Kaidan -Geisha Shinmichi -Jizozaka -Koshoji Temple Your guide may take you around other interesting, historical places in Kagurazaka! Consult with your guide with what you want to see in Kagurazaka and they will think of the perfect spots for you to visit! Come explore the streets of Kagurazaka and witness some parts of Edo Period! You will not get bored in this small vibrant neighborhood! Photo Credits: https://flic.kr/p/6EaBG9 https://flic.kr/p/7Z4a3u https://flic.kr/p/dSjY8m https://flic.kr/p/8gqL3j
strTitle: Tour Around the Lively Neighborhood of Kagurazaka!

strIntroduction: Have a kayak and snorkeling adventure in Blue Cave, Okinawa! Enjoy the sunny beach and marvel at the glowing blue ocean in between crevices and tunnels. Here is the itinerary: - Gather at our handmade marine house. - Get into a kayak and row out towards the "Blue Cave". Enjoy a panoramic view of cliffs, coastlines, and subtropical plants while you leisurely row your kayak. - When a huge cave appears, kayak onto the shore nearby and have some tea. - Snorkeling practice in the ocean near the shore. - Head towards Okinawa's ocean! - Enjoy snorkeling, play with tropical fish, explore the mysterious and magical Blue Cave with sunlight glistening from the bottom. This tour departs at 8:30, 10:30, 13:30, and 15:00 every day. Please state your preferred timing when you make your booking, and if you require pickup, your hotel in Onna village. If you're staying outside Onna village, please come to the meeting point by bus or taxi. Let's enjoy amazing Kayak and Snorkel in Okinawa! We're looking forward to hearing from you!
strTitle: Enjoy A Day of Snorkeling at Okinawa Blue Cave with Kayaking

strIntroduction: How would you like to fly through the night sky of Tokyo in your very own private helicopter? Tokyo has one of the most beautiful night views in the world, with many landmarks that you will find during your flight. Spot the Tokyo Tower, Skytree, the ferris wheel at Odaiba, and the Rainbow Bridge all lit up in beautiful colors. This ride is completely private, and is perfect for romantic dates. Take your precious partner for a flight, and it will be the most memorable moment during your stay in Tokyo. You can choose from the following breathtaking courses: Night Cruising: Odaiba, Rainbow Bridge, Ginza, and Tokyo station. Prestige Course (night): Odaiba, Rainbow Bridge, Tokyo Tower, Roppongi, Shibuya, Shinjuku, Tokyo Dome, Ueno, Asakusa, and Tokyo station. Sky Tree Course (day): Odaiba, Rainbow Bridge, Tokyo Tower, Tokyo Midtown, Tokyo Dome, Ueno Park, Tokyo Sky Tree, Ryogoku. Happy Anniversary Plan (day or night): Helicopter port, Rainbow Bridge, Tokyo Tower, Akasaka, Shinjuku, Tokyo Dome, Akihabara, Asakusa, Marunouchi, Shibaura. Mt. Fuji Panorama View (day): Helicopter port, Tokyo Tower, Kamakura, Enoshima, Hakone Ashinoko, Shinjuku, Tokyo Sky Tree. All listed durations include 5 minutes scheduled for embarking/disembarking the helicopter. ※The last departure time for Night Cruising: 20:00 (Meeting Time: 19:40) ※The last departure time for Prestige Course: 19:50 (Meeting Time: 19:30)
strTitle: Helicopter Night Cruising in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Guide: Shuri Misono (味園 朱利) Join me on this Izakaya Pub Crawl tour! I know fantastic pub locations in Japan for drinking such as hidden taverns that only locals know about, as well as popular tourist attractions. Izakaya is the term for a Japanese-style pub where people go after work for casual drinking. The main pub I will introduce you to is the Chain Store, as it is traveller-friendly, although not many travellers know about this place. Another nice restaurant that I will bring you to is Self-Employment. This establishment has been around for decades, however even many young local Japanese do not know of this shop as they have not dared to explore these hidden places. I can also guide you through famous tourists places in Tokyo if you want, such as Akihabara, where you can feel the pulse of anime dance music on the streets and enjoy watching cartoons such as Moe Moe Kyun Maid Cafe. Join me on this flexible and fun tour! <My specialty places> Asakusa, Ueno, Shinbashi, Akihabara, Shinjuku Omoide Yokocho (a side street), Izakaya street, and Ueno bar in Ameyoko. Availability: Weekends, public holidays, and weekday nights. Please contact me in advance. It's very short for 1.5 hours. I can't do anymore than introduce 1 pub. I recommend 2 hours. If there are many 1 participants, I do jointly. This is an rare case. If you wish for a private tour only of 1 person, please contact me beforehand. Photo by https://flic.kr/p/eXkXLC
strTitle: Join hidden Izakaya＆Sake Pub Crawl Tour in Tokyo

strIntroduction: The world of sumo attracts plenty of foreign visitors in Japan who want to experience the exciting emotion of seeing sumo wrestlers fight against each other. However, the national tournaments are held only several times per year and in different cities. Booking a sumo morning practice tour will give you access directly to the wrestlers' home, but even those tours are not held every week. If you have no chance to see sumo wrestlers fighting in real, or if you want to enhance the valuable memories from your trip to Japan with a personal interaction with wrestlers, then this is the ideal occasion! In the past many visitors have been asking how to get a chance to duel a sumo wrestler on a one-to-one friendly fight, and this is no longer impossible! By attending this special show in Asakusa you will have the rare opportunity to try your luck and strength against a real sumo wrestler, learn more about the traditional techniques used during the tournaments, and eat a well-balanced healthy chanko-nabe hot pot! This is a special event offered entirely in English for international visitors in Tokyo. The show is offered every Monday from 11:45 am under the following schedule: 11:45 - the venue opens 12:00 - start of the stage show in which two former sumo wrestlers will show essential techniques, explain about the history, culture and practices of sumo, and fight against each other. Several people from the audience will be picked to dress in a funny sumo wrestler costume (don't worry, you will not need to take off any clothes) and challenge the former stars in a duel. Photo time will end this session. Note: Not every visitor will be chosen to duel with the sumo wrestlers. 12:50 - chanko-nabe hot pot will be served for lunch. You can try the delicious traditional food eaten by sumo wrestlers and learn more about their diet. The nutritious meal has been cooked by the wrestlers themselves and includes hot pot with seasonal ingredients (not vegetarian), rice, miso, salad, fries, yuzu citrus dessert and a non-alcoholic drink. The event ends after you finish your lunch. You will also receive the current sumo ranking as a present. This is a group event and there will be other guests in the hall (up to 50 people). The hall has tatami mats and you will be sitting on a cushion on the floor (a chair will be provided for guests with limited mobility). Note: Be punctual because the show will start exactly at 12:00 pm. Enjoy the unique sumo wrestlers show and have unforgettable memories from your trip to Japan!
strTitle: Duel with sumo wrestlers and eat chanko nabe in Asakusa show

strIntroduction: This is a very popular ear cleaning and foot massage service offered in Akihabara, Tokyo, by real Akihabara maids! You will lie down and place your head over the soft pillow while the professionally trained maid will massage your head and help you relax completely! After this refreshing procedure you will understand why so many people are passionate fans of the the famous ear-cleaning services in Akihabara! This activity is suitable for booking for single visitor or a small group. Please note that the time of the booking will be strictly observed. Do not be late for your appointment. If you are even 10 minutes late, the reservation will be cancelled. We recommend arriving in Akihabara earlier to find your place to our shop. Our shop is open every day under the following schedule: Weekdays: 12:00 - 22:00 Weekends and national holidays: 11:00 - 22:00 You can choose between a 30, 45, 60, 90 or 120-minute relaxation plan which includes ear cleaning, massage of the face, the head, the shoulders, the hands and your body. In addition, you can choose one or more drinks from our drink menu depending on the duration of the service! If you would like to book the special foot massage service, you can choose between a 30 or 60-minute shiatsu foot massage with aroma oil. One drink is included too. In addition, you can select a special 60, 90, 120 or 180-minute aromatherapy plan with drinks included! Note: Our shop does not offer sexual services.
strTitle: Get an ear cleaning and foot massage by an Akihabara maid!

strIntroduction: In this 3-hour Shibuya Food Tour you will not need a Shibuya map or Shibuya travel guide. We show our guests the delicious side of Shibuya, a place more known for being at the forefront of culture and fashion, and rarely known for its food. People always ask where to go in Shibuya. Of course there is the Shibuya crossing location and most people know that Shibuya is close to Harajuku but Shibuya restaurants either cater to tourists or they cater to the locals. We want to show our guests the places to go in Shibuya, the places the locals go, so the next time they visit they can do as a local does. Experience a part of Shibuya that no tourist will ever see on their own with the most delicious food only locals usually get to taste. Get the chance to try Yakitori, Kobe Beef or Wagyu beef skewer, Osaka Takoyaki, Okonomiyaki, 7 kinds of sushi, and Taiyaki! Nestled in the back alleys, these places are unforgettable and an experience you wont want to miss.
strTitle: Go out on a Shibuya Evening Walking Food Tour!

These cafes reproduce ''Alice's Adventures in Wonderland'', and each cafe has different concept. -Alice in a Magical Land- (Shinjuku, Tokyo) Welcome to the world in which Alice gets lost and ventures! Once you step in, there is a fantasy world where a lot of unique habitants are living. Why don't you spend your dream time as if you are under a magic spell? (Reservation time) Lunch: 11:00 am - 3:00 pm (Last Order 2:30 pm) Dinner: 5:00 pm - 0:00 am (Last Order 11:00 pm) -Alice in a Labyrinth- (Ginza, Tokyo) A big picture book meets at the entrance: ''It is the door to Wonderland.'' If the door of the entrance is open so that the page can be turned over, the labyrinth world between the dream and reality will spread over inside. (Reservation time) 4:00 pm - 11:30 pm (Last Order 11:00 pm) -Alice in Fantasy book- (Kabukicho, Tokyo) Welcome to the Alice's Wonderland. In this world, you are going to be Alice. Once you step in, you will meet the amusing strange character and the dreamy parallel world. (Reservation time) 4:00 pm - 0:00 am (Last Order 11:00 pm) -Alice in an Old Castle- (Ikebukuro, Tokyo) Once you enter inside, there is the world that is controlled by the ''Red Queen''. You are Alice in this world, and you will be invited to the Red Queen's dinner party. (Reservation time) 5:00 pm - 11:30 pm (Last Order 10:30 pm) -Alice in a Dancing Land- (Shibuya, Tokyo) If you go downstairs to the basement, there is a dancing world where Alice and her wonderful friends sing and dance. (Reservation time) Lunch: 11:00 am - 4:00 pm (Last Order 3:30 pm) Dinner: 5:00 pm - 11:30 pm (Last Order 11:00 pm) -Alice in fantasy land- (Umeda, Osaka) (Reservation time) 5:00 pm - 11:00 pm (Last Order 10:00 pm) -Alice in the silver screen- (Nagoya, Aichi) (Reservation time) Lunch: 11:00 am - 3:00 pm (Last Order 2:00 pm) Cafe: 2:00 pm - 5:00 pm (Last Order 4:00 pm) Dinner: 5:00 pm - 11:30 pm (Last Order 10:30 pm) In this activity, you will choose one of Alice's restaurant you want to try. Food and drinks are themed as well to help creating a wonderfully magical Alice experience. Pick your favorite and get lost in Alice's amazing world. ※This is the reservation service only. You will need to pay for drinks and meals at the cafe.
strTitle: Reservation for Alice's Cafes in Tokyo, Osaka and Nagoya
Make Your Own Tenugui (Japanese cotton hand towel) in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Yokohama Bay is truly one of the best sightseeing spots in Japan. The combination of futuristic new buildings, skyscrapers, theme parks with a giant Ferris Wheel, shopping centers, industrial areas and seaside parks is unique and attracts plenty of visitors all year round. This area, also called "Minato-Mirai", is especially astonishing at night time. There are several places to see the glamourous lights of the bay city from above - for example from the the guest rooms of the nearby skyscraper hotels. This activity will elevate you even higher as you will fly up in the sky to enjoy the panorama in its entire beauty! The helicopter rises up to 400-600 meters and provides a fantastic view over the bay area right after sunset. Even though the flight time is short (5-10 minutes), you will never forget what you'll see! This is the ideal surprise and romantic present for someone you love. The memories from the helicopter trip over Yokohama Bay will be unforgettable. You can choose between several flight time slots: 1) Queen option: Take off around the time of the sunset and enjoy the twilight sky which changes several colours! The silhouette of Mt Fuji against the red sky is magical! This flight takes about 5 minutes. 2) King option: Take off after sunset and enjoy the night view and all the glamorous lights of Yokohama Bay. The contrast with the dark sea is splendid! This flight takes about 5 minutes. 3) Gold option: Take off after sunset and fly for 10 minutes! This is one of the most popular tours. 4)Platinum option: Take off anytime during the business hours and fly for 20 minutes. You can enjoy the breathtaking view of Tokyo and Yokahama 5)Ultimate option: Take off anytime during the business hours and fly for 30 minutes. If you fly at night, you can compare the sunset of Tokyo and Yokohama bay at the same time. 6)Flower bouquet option: Flower bouquet option, for options other than platinum and ultimate options. 7)Balloon bouquet option: Balloon bouquet option, for options other than platinum and ultimate options. 8)Photo book option: Photo book option, for options other than platinum and ultimate options. Helicopters take off between 16:00 and 20:30, depending on the seasonal sunset time. Please note that all tours can have up to 5 passengers and you might be flying together with other guests. If you like to rent the helicopter privately, please enquire about private tours (additional fees will apply). [Child Price] Please note that the child price for shared rides applies for 4-11 years old passengers and adult price applies for 12 years old and above Infants of age 3 and below can sit on parents lap and ride for free. This activity is offered only on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and national holidays.
strTitle: Night cruising over Yokohama Bay with a helicopter!

strIntroduction: Yokohama is just 30 minutes south of Tokyo and is the country's most important harbour. The city developed during the later years of the Edo period when it became one of the few ports to be opened to international merchants and missionaries. During the Meiji period Yokohama flourished and many foreign diplomats and traders built their Western-style residences along the slopes of the Yamate Hill. This changed the image of the city and turned it into one of the most attractive places in Japan. Yokohama is home to many entertainment and shopping facilities, museums and factories. In this full day private guided tour you will visit many of Yokohama's great highlights. The itinerary is open for customization, but we suggest the following must-see sites: - Sankeien Garden, a beautiful Japanese-style garden built by a wealthy silk trader. It exhibits numerous historic buildings relocated from various parts of Japan. Don't miss the opportunity to have a cup of Japanese green tea surrounded by the pleasant nature in this garden. - Minato-Mirai area, the centerpiece attraction of Yokohama which consists of the giant Landmark Tower, the theme park World Porters and the attractive shopping malls Queen's Square and Red Brick Warehouses. Be sure to go to the top of the Landmark Tower and enjoy the panorama view from the observatory! - Yamashita Park and Osanbashi Pier, the most pleasant seaside area of Yokohama where you can freely walk in the spacious green park and enjoy the view of the bay. This place is ideal of lovers of photography. - Chinatown, Japan's biggest and most colourful one, where you can eat plenty of delicious food and find lavishly decorated temples and shop.s - Motomachi shopping street and Yamate Hill. Both of these place have a distinct Western flavour. You can enter several of the former residences, now turned into museums, or go shopping in the top-class stores of Motomachi street. Other interesting places worth visiting, if time allows, are the Cup Noodle Museum (located in Minato-Mirai area) and the Ramen Museum close to Shin-Yokohama Station.
strTitle: Visit all of Yokohama's famous sites in a day tour!

strIntroduction: Of the many programs taking you around lovely Kamakura, here is one with a nautical twist! After enjoying the ancient temples in and around Kamakura, you will head towards nearby Yokosuka to get a bit of naval history. Cruise the harbour and climb aboard the Mikasa, a warship used in the Russo-Japan war. Kamakura is just an hour from Tokyo but offers yet another world. It is also known as "little Kyoto" because of its greenery and hundreds of wooden temples. Kenchoji is the number one of Kamakura's five great Zen temples, and the oldest of them all. It has an impressive gate and when you climb all the way through towards the end of the grounds you will get a nice panorama view over the hills. Tsurugaoka Hachimangu is Kamakura's most important shrine. It was founded in 1063 by Minamoto Yoriyoshi. The shrine is dedicated to Hachiman, the patron god of the Minamoto family and of the samurai class in general. For many Japanese a visit and offering at this shrine is a must, especially on religious days. Therefore it is a great spot to watch the locals going about their rituals. The Hase temple, or Hasedera, is a little outside of central Kamakura but should not be missed. It combines a lovely garden with great views across the bay and of course there you will find the golden statue of Kannon, the goddess of mercy. This statue shows Kannon with eleven heads, each representing a characteristic of the goddess. The 9.18 meter tall, gilded wooden statue is regarded as one of the largest wooden sculpture in Japan, and can be found in the temple's main building, the Kannon-do Hall. From Hasedera it is a very short walk to go and meet the large bronze Buddha you may have already spotted peering over the trees. "The Great Buddha of Kamakura" (the Kamakura Daibutsu) is a bronze statue standing on the grounds of Kotokuin Temple. With a height of 13.35 meters, it is the second tallest bronze Buddha statue in Japan. From here you continue to Kamakura station, by local bus or by a short hop on the scenic Enoden electric line. Change trains and cross the peninsular to Yokosuka, well known for its naval bases, both Japanese and American. Sometimes submarines can be seen mored just across from the train station! It is a pleasant stroll to the park where the Mikasa awaits you. Mikasa is a battleship built for the Imperial Japanese Navy in the late 1890s, and was the only ship of her class. It was the flagship of Admiral Togo Heihachiro throughout the Russo-Japanese War of 1904–1905, including the Battle of Port Arthur. You can climb aboard and all over it. Smell the salt on a boat trip across the military harbour and come closer to the various warships mored at Yokotsuka on most days. Return to Tokyo by a direct train at the end of this exciting one-day trip. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Summary of the tour: - meet your guide in Kamakura - explore the Kenchoji Temple, the Tsurugaoka Hachimangu Shrine, the Hasedera Temple and its garden, and the Great Buddha of Kamakura - head for Yokotsuka by train (not included in the tour price) - climb onto the warship Mikasa - make a boat trip in the military harbour - return to Tokyo by train (not included in the tour price)
strTitle: Ancient Kamakura and the naval history of Yokosuka

strIntroduction: Inuyama is a city located north of Nagoya in Aichi prefecture, in the valley of Kiso River. Inuyama is a popular holiday destination especially for residents of Nagoya. While the most famous sightseeing spot is the attractive Inuyama Castle, the city is home to several unique theme parks which are worth a day visit. Kiso River is one of the few places in Japan where you can see the tradition of cormorant fishing (only in summer and early autumn). In this customized tour you will visit Inuyama's highlights in a day. You will be able to choose which theme park to visit, although our main recommendation is Meiji Mura. Here is a list of the places of interest in Inuyama: - Inuyama Castle, the oldest surviving wooden castle in Japan and a national treasure. The castle was built in 1537 by Oda Nobunaga's uncle Oda Nobuyasu. It stands on the river bank of Kiso river and offers great views to the city and the valley. Inuyama Castle's approach includes passing along a nice shopping street with traditional buildings and warehouses. - Urakuen, another national treasure and one of Japan's best tea houses. It was built by Oda Nobunaga's brother Oda Uraku to preserve the teachings of the tea master Sen-no-Rikyu. Originally the tea house and the garden were in Kyoto but were later moved to Inuyama. You can drink a cup of tea and enjoy the scenery of the garden which is especially beautiful during the autumn colors. - Meiji Mura, a spacious open air museum where plenty of Japanese buildings from the Meiji period (late 19th and early 20th century) have been moved or reconstructed. If you're interested in the story of Japan's modernization and westernization, this is a great place to visit. Your guide will tell you in details about each building exhibited. However, you may choose to visit another theme park in Inuyama, in which case you can select between the following options: - Little World, a unique open air museum displaying dwellings of various people from all over the world. The exhibits range from Mongolian yurts to African clay huts and idyllic French countryside houses. - Japan Monkey Center, a museum-zoo with hundreds of monkeys from 67 different species. It is the biggest monkey zoo in the world. In fact, Inuyama has so many great things to see that you will want to visit this place again!
strTitle: Take a day trip from Nagoya to Inuyama and see unique sites!

strIntroduction: Nagoya is Japan's fourth largest city, conveniently located along the Tokaido Shinkansen bullet train line. More than just a transportation hub, Nagoya fascinates visitors with its unique combination of rich historical legacy and high-tech industrial development. The coexistence of old monuments and modern-day districts creates a specific atmosphere that summarizes the best of the varied experiences Japan offers to foreign visitors. In Nagoya you can hop between the centuries while casually walking around the city's central area. Here you can not only visit famous sightseeing spots, but also see the life of local people and learn much about Japan's history and traditions. In this one-day walking tour you will visit Nagoya's best known attractions with a professional guide. You will be introduced to the highlights of Nagoya Castle, Sakae downtown area, and Osu district. At the end of the day you will know a lot more about Japan's samurai history and the lifestyle of local people. Below is the itinerary of the tour. Please note that the time schedule is suggested and you can start the tour at a later time as well. 8:50 - Pick up from Nagoya Station's Tourism Information Office, then take the subway to Nagoya Castle 9:45 - See Nagoya Castle, a wonderful masterpiece of Japanese medieval architecture, famous for its golden roof ornaments and unique scroll paintings inside the recently renovated main palace. After strolling around the spacious castle complex, you will take the subway to Nagoya's heart, Sakae district. 11:00 - 13:00 - Explore Sakae's downtown area and visit the futuristic-looking landmark Oasis 21 where you will find plenty of restaurants and shops. Have lunch and taste delicious local specialties. See Nagoya TV Tower before taking the subway to your next destination. 13:00 - Go to Osu Shopping District and enter various local shops along the roof-covered arcade, including green tea shops, pachinko parlors, maid cafes, and pop-culture shops. You will also visit the splendid Osu Kannon Temple that stands at the end of the arcade. 15:30 - End of the tour
strTitle: Explore the samurai legacy of Nagoya with a private guide

strIntroduction: Ishikawa prefecture's Kanazawa city is rich in cultural traditions, history and unique local art, crafts and delicacies. The city's relative proximity to Shirakawa-go, Takayama and Kyoto makes it very accessible for travelers. Furthermore, the Shinkansen will connect Tokyo to Kanazawa directly in just 2.5 hours from March 2015! Kanazawa city was established around a shrine and a farmer market, but quickly developed into one of Japan's richest and biggest cities during the Maeda feudal clan rule in the Edo period. Kanazawa's most famous art and craft is the gold leaf production, whose history dates back to 16th century and has been well preserved today. On this half day private tour you will visit a selection of the city's highlights guided by a local expert who will tell you everything about the rich history and culture of Kanazawa. The following is an example of the itinerary which can be customized according to your preferences (the order of the places visited can be changed): 1. Higashi-chaya geisha district: one of Kanazawa's highlight and very well preserved area with many geisha houses that are still practicing. Nearby you can visit the famous gold leaf shops. 2. Kenrokuen: one of the three most beautiful Japanese gardens in the country (the other two being Korakuen in Okayama and Kairakuen in Mito, Ibaraki prefecture). The stone lanterns are an iconic symbol of Kanazawa city. Kenrokuen closes at 5pm. 3. Kanazawa Castle: unique remaining white gateway with spacious gardens. It closes at 6pm 4. Nagamachi samurai district: the former samurai district with narrow alleys and well preserved residences. Other optional places to visit are available too. The itinerary is flexible and can be customized.
strTitle: Half day tour around the highlights of Kanazawa city

strIntroduction: Visit Hakone, one of Japan’s most famous tourist destinations to enjoy the great scenery of Mt. Fuji by cruising along Lake Ashinoko! In addition, also enjoy an all-you-can-eat yakiniku lunch before spending your time for shopping at Gotemba Premium Outlets! This tour departs from Hotel Gracery Shinjuku or Shinjuku Washington Hotel and will take you to Hakone, one of Japan most famous tourist destinations, where you can enjoy the view of Mt. Fuji. In Hakone, you will cruise along Lake Ashinoko and visit Togendai Port, where you can take the Hakone Ropeway to Owakudani station. After that you will take a walk around the volcanic fumes of Owakudani and then you will have a 50 minutes lunch where you can eat yakiniku, sushi, curry, French fries, and desserts as much as you want (see below for changes of the menu from January 2017). Later on, you will visit Gotemba Premium Outlets, one of the largest outlet shopping malls in Japan, where you can buy exclusive branded stuff with much lower price. You can also see the Mt. Fuji from the shopping arcade too, as it is located pretty close from Mt. Fuji. During your trip, you can participate in the lucky draw event to win prizes and you can get a folding shopping bag for free (limited offer until the end of September) as well! The bus will be equipped with free Wi-Fi & electrical outlet, so you can stay mobile while travelling! The itinerary for this tour is as follows: - Depart from Hotel Gracery Shinjuku (7:50) or - Depart from Shinjuku Washington Hotel (8:10) - Take the bus to Moto Hakone Port - Get on the Hakone Pirateship and cruise around Lake Ashinoko (30 minutes) - Arrive at Togendai Port and walk to Togendai Station - Get on the Hakone Ropeway to Owakudani Station (16 minutes) - Walk to Owakudani Valley (40-50 minutes) - Have a lunch buffet (50 minutes) - Visit Gotemba Premium Outlets for shopping (120-150 minutes) - Return to Shinjuku and tour ends in between 18:00-18:30 Note: The lunch menu will change from January 2017: Until December 2016 departures Yakiniku lunch (All-you-can eat about 100 kinds of dishes including yakiniku./50 min From January 2017 departures Buffet lunch of 67 kinds of dishes (70 minutes): beef, pork, and chicken yakiniku (Korean BBQ), deep-fried chicken, kushikatsu skewered meat cutlet with miso, dessert, etc. This tour departs from Shinjuku on: Weekdays: Sep. 16, 21, 23, 28, 30, Oct. 05, 07, 12, 14, 19, 21, 26, 28, Nov. 02, 04, 09, 11, 16, 18, 23, 25, 30, Dec. 02, 07, 09, 14, 16, 21, 23, 28, 30 Weekend: Sep. 18, 25, Oct. 02, 09, 16, 23, 30, Nov. 06, 13, 20, 27, Dec. 04, 11, 18, 25 Mt. Fuji is one of the best sceneries that you can see in Japan, and Gotemba is a very fun place to stroll and shop around! Make sure that you make a reservation with our service in advance! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Mt. Fuji Cruising, Yakiniku Lunch, & Outlets Shopping!
Lunch with the Voyagin Founder and Staff

strIntroduction: Have an experience to share - watch a dance performance at a cross-dresser bar in Roppongi. Located in “Roppongi” the most famous district for nightlife in Japan, Roppongi Kingyo is a major show-pub restaurant in Tokyo, Japan that is star-studded by such notabilities as world-famous film directors, and world-class fashion designers. The fusion of the stage set that evolves into every-changing shape and avant-garde productions, called “Neo-Kabuki”, is quite an entertainment that we could proudly offer to a worldwide audience. The pretty, fascinating and powerful performance given by the male, female, and New-Half dancers through the 60-minute show time, would definitely dazzle you! ※ Option Detail ※ You can choose between 2 time frames and 4 different plans, outlined below! First choose between the 2 time frames, then choose your preferred plan of food and beverages. 【Schedule】 Check in 1st show 18:00-18:30 / 2nd show 21:00 Show start 1st show 19:30 / 2nd show 22:00 Finish 1st show 20:30 / 2nd show 23:00 【Options】 1. Beverage Course (Snacks,drink buffet) 2. Silver Course (Two-tiered Japanese dishes & Free Drink Service) 3. Gold Course (Appetizer plates & drink buffet) 4. Platinum Course (Three-tiered combo & Drink buffet) *Only Gold Course and Platinum Course include beer. this tour is provided by HIS
strTitle: See a dance performance at Roppongi Kingyo in Roppongi!

strIntroduction: Osaka is known as the Water City of Japan because of its many rivers and canals. One of the greatest ways to enjoy your trip to Osaka is to take a pleasure boat along the rivers. In the sakura cherry blossoms period you can rent an entire boat and embark on an unforgettable sailing journey under the beautiful cherry trees! This relazing boat tour offers one unique way to appreciate the splendid sakura blossoms along Osaka's rivers. Bring your own food or order catering and have a sailing "hanami" (sakura appreciation picnic). You'll be amazed by the surrounding beauty of the cherry trees whose blossoming branches are almost touching the water surface. Along the way you'll be able to see Osaka Castle in the distance, surrounded by beautiful cherry blossom trees! This tour is offered for small groups of up to 10 people. It is available between March 25 and April 15, from 11:20 am to 8:20 pm.
strTitle: Enjoy a splendid sakura blossoms cruise in Osaka

strIntroduction: Your experience will include stops at 12 family owned stalls and shops which have stood the test of time. At a few of the stops we will sample specialty products like tsukemono (vegetables from the surrounding mountains preserved in vinegar), yuba (the world's smoothest sashimi tofu made from the world famous Kyoto mountain water), and sparkling sake straight from the tap. At the other stops we will buy some specialty items for us to enjoy later at lunch including Saba (Mackerel), Dashimaki Tamago (specialty grilled egg dish made from specialty Kyoto fish and seaweed stock), Sansho (Japanese red pepper), Kamaboko (seafood preserved in fish paste), Tako (Octopus with quail egg) and Matcha (ground tea leaves). During the tour you will learn detailed information about the ingredients of different Japanese dishes, how their food is prepared and what is used to eat it. You will learn the process, from the ground to your bowl, of how white rice is processed for consumption and the origin of roasted tea leaves! Your experience will do more than just give you a chance to taste Kyoto's delicious food but will also give you a sense the history and atmosphere of the Nishiki Market experienced by the Japanese for generations. You will be consumed with physical and visual stimuli every step of the way and will enjoy stories from the past told directly from shopkeepers and families we will spend time with. We look forward to welcoming you to one of most beloved tours in all of Japan and hope to see you soon.
strTitle: Explore Kyoto on a Daytime Walking Food Tour

strIntroduction: Go on a Paraglide for an adventurous experience in Okinawa! Let's fly like a bird over the emerald-green coral! We offer a sightseeing flight with paragliding / motor paragliding. You and one veteran pilot will board a motor paraglider from a sandy beach and set to a height of 200 meters. Don't be afraid, even if we switch off the engine, you will land safely on the sandy beach so you absolutely will not get wet. There will be 2 air crafts in flight so you can take pictures together in the sky if you join as a couple or in groups. This experience is suitable for people of all ages. Nov to Mar: 10:00 -11:30 / 13:00 -16:00 Apr to Oct: 10:00 - 11:30 / 13:00 -17:00 This activity will be held every day except for rainy or windy days. As the destination of flights changes due to direction of wind, we will send you notification if the activity is cancelled. Let's paraglide amazing Okinawan blue sky!
strTitle: Paraglide the Beautiful Blue Skies of Okinawa!

strIntroduction: Join this tour to visit Northern part of Okinawa, and visit the Churaumi Aquarium and the Nago Pineapple Park, with a return transfer to Naha Airport! This one day bus tour takes you straight to the famous Churaumi Aquarium, where you can enjoy seeing tremendous whale sharks, manta rays, and other sea creatures. You will also have a stop at Nago Pineapple Park, where you can explore the park and enjoy the taste of the samples of locally grown pineapples. You can also enjoy the treats, from cakes to wine, at the Park. Before returning to Naha Airport, you will have a quick stop at Glass no Mori to enjoy a splash of Ryukyu's traditional art as you will see the real Ryukyu glasswares. The itinerary for the tour is as follows: - 07:40-08:20 Check-in at Naha Bus Temporary Office or Pick-up at Designated Hotels Naha Bus Terminal (depart on 8:00) Okinawa Miyako Hotel (depart on 08:15) Hotel Nikko Naha Grand Castle (depart on 08:20) - Churaumi Aquarium (3.5 Hours) You will have your lunch here - Nago Pineapple Park (40 minutes) - Glass no Mori (30 minutes) - 16:30-16:45 Drop-off at Naha Airport - 17:00 Tour ends at Naha Bus Terminal Reservation is difficult to make, so we recommend you to use our reservation service and book the tour with no hassles!
strTitle: Visit Churaumi Aquarium&Pineapple Park with Airport Transfer

strIntroduction: ★Start from 1st June, we will go to one more spot is Cape Manza★ This is a one day sightseeing bus tour to Okinawa in which you will visit the following highlights: - the amazing view of the pristine blue sea from Kouri Island Bridge (Japan’s longest toll free bridge) - the world’s largest fish tank with whale sharks, which is known as “The Kuroshio Sea” - "Ryukyu Village", a historical folk village that recreates the culture and lifestyle of an ancient Okinawa village. Old private houses were moved from various parts of Okinawa and relocated here. Demonstrations, as well as classes featuring traditional Okinawa indigo dyeing (Bingata), painting on Shisa (pottery) are held at the houses. Note: The price does not include lunch. Please be prepared to take care of your own lunch during the 150 minutes of free time at Churaumi Aquarium. Meeting times and places: 1）Pallette Kumoji in front of Nippon Rent-A-Car 8:20 am 2）T Galleria near the GEO 8:50 am Time required: 10 hours Disclaimer: 1. The order of the tour destinations could be changed due to traffic conditions on the day. 2. The price does not include lunch. Please be prepared to take care of your own lunch during the 150 minutes of free time at Churaumi Aquarium. 3. Depend on the traffic conditions, the traveling time may vary. 4. We are not responsible if you are late for a scheduled event after this tour is completed, due to traffic jams or other delays, which may occur. If you are catching a flight after the tour, please plan accordingly and give yourself at least two hours time before the plane's departure. 5. No smoking. 6. strIntroduction: Gion, the centuries old entertainment district, truly comes alive at night. We take you on a walk through the old tea house district, explain the customs of the geisha and apprentice maiko and help you discover this hidden world. Here we might even have a chance to catch a few of the girls in full costume rushing off to an appointment. A special sight indeed. As we walk through these narrow streets with the lanterns flickering on the wooden buildings you can feel the charm of this special place. Wandering along these cobbled streets we will also take you to some places with a truly remarkable atmosphere. A night visit to a shrine, a full pagoda all lit up and other places of historic importance will leave an impression on you that you will never forget. But this is not just a place for the entertainers of old, it also has a thriving nightlife. After a long stroll it’s now time to enjoy a refreshing drink at a local pub with big bay windows. From here we can look out at the hostess clubs girls, bouncers and patrons all spilling out to the streets while we talk about the unique customs of Japanese nightlife of days old and new. 7:00pm - 9:30pm
strTitle: Go on a Gion Night Walk, Kyoto

strIntroduction: Declared a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1995, the historic village of Shirakawa-go and neighboring Gokayama regions are a must-visit for guests looking to marvel at these world-famous gassho-zukuri houses. While these villages are located in the remote mountains spanning from Gifu to Toyama Prefectures, they make an easy day tour from Takayama. The term Gassho-zukuri means "constructed like hands in prayer", as it is said that these steep thatched roofs resemble the hands of Buddhist monks pressed together. This unique architectural style was developed over many generations to withstand heavy snowfall during winter, and are an amazing sight to see in person! Some of the houses are over 250 years old, and the roofs, made without nails, provided large attic space used for cultivating silkworms. If you'd like to see these amazing villages, we can help you arrange half day or full day tours. You can even opt to stay at an overnight stay in one of the farmhouses, which give you much more time to relax and soak in the peaceful atmosphere (request this by sending us a message). HALF DAY TOUR ITINERARY - Morning tour 08.10 : Bus leaves Takayama station 09.00 : Arrive in Shirakawa-go 09.00 - 11.00: Free time to explore Shirakawa-go 11.00: Depart for Takayama 12.00: Arrive back in Takayama HALF DAY TOUR ITINERARY - Afternoon tour 13.20: Bus leaves Takayama station 14.10: Arrive in Shirakawa-go 14.10 - 16.10: Free time to explore Shirakawa-go 16.10: Depart for Takayama 17.10: Arrive back in Takayama FULL DAY TOUR ITINERARY 08.15: Meet at Takayama Nohi Bus Terminal 08.30: Depart Takayama Nohi Bus Terminal - Explore Gokayama Ainokura Village (50 minutes) - Lunch at Shirakawago Gassho Shuraku Shiroyama observation tower overlooking the valley. You will be able to get a taste of the famous Ishiwari Tofu of Shirakawa-go. - Explore Shirakawago village and the Open-Air Museum - Gassho Zukuri Minka-en - with 25 relocated gassho-zukuri buildings assembled in pleasant countryside, some of which have demonstrations of local handicrafts. 15.10: Arrive back at Takayama Nohi Bus Terminal
strTitle: Visit the World-Famous Farmhouses of Shirakawa-go

strIntroduction: Kyoto has a large cultural legacy coming from its 1200 year-long history and offers an incredible number of attractions for tourists. Among them, this private walking tour is planned to discover Kyoto's hidden beauty and explore the heart of Kyoto. The guide will take you not only to major tourists' spots but also to lesser-known alleys and markets. At the end of the tour, you will agree that the best feature of Kyoto city is the mixture of the new and the old! ☆Tour Course☆ The tour starts from Kyoto station. (If you book a hotel pickup option,the tour starts from lobby of your hotel. The picking applicable hotels are limited to the hotels between Higashi-oji-dori and Nishi-oji-dori (to the east and west) and Imadegawa-dori and Jujo-dori(to the north and south. If you need a taxi or a hired car, an additional fee will be charged.) ↓ Sanjusangen-do ↓ Kiyomizu Temple ↓ Sannenzaka ↓ Gion ↓ End of tour (Tour guide will assist you how to get to the subway station or the nearby bus stop for your next visiting spot or your hotel) ☆Tour Highlight☆ "Don't jump off the cliff" / Kiyomizu Temple This temple predates the foundation of Kyoto and has had millions of pilgrims ever since. It is designated as a UNESCO World Heritage site with over 30 structures, including a huge wooden veranda in front of the main hall that juts out over the cliff and provides you a panoramic view of Kyoto. There is a famous expression: that states "You must jump off the stage of Kiyomizu." It means that you should take the plunge to make your dreams come true. "Most walked street in Kyoto" / Sannenzaka This sloped path leading to Kiyomizu temple was originally paved with stones in about 808 AD and may be the most walked street in Kyoto. It is lined with old wooden houses running restaurants and shops selling pottery, artworks and other traditional goods. You may come across young women dressed in kimono and feel as though you had traveled back in time to the days of 300 years ago. "Encounter Geiko and Maiko" / Gion Gion is the entertainment district beautifully lined with traditional town houses and restaurants, you will encounter geiko and maiko, professional entertainers trained in traditional Japanese dance and music, including the playing the shamisen (like a three-stringed guitar) and singing. They can be seen wearing, beautiful, elaborate kimonos as they walk to and from appointments.
strTitle: Exploring the Heart of Kyoto (Half Day)

strIntroduction: Are you interested in home-made Japanese cuisines and the seasonings used in them - like Miso? Miso is a traditional Japanese seasoning which we use for our everyday food like Miso soup, marinades, hotpots and a variety of other cooking sauces. You might assume we all buy them from supermarkets - well, yes, most of us get pre-packed Miso in the 21st century. However, our grandmas and ancestors made them by fermenting soybeans, sea salt and Koji (the special Japanese fungus Aspergillus oryzae) A couple of years ago I discovered the very interesting world of home-made Miso, and started making my own with my family and friends since then. It is a very fun process of mixing ingredients – and also a very romantic one where you will let it sleep for a year whilst taking care of it like your baby ;) After a year of anticipation, your Miso will taste differently from anyone else’s! So why don't you join me and try making your own miso? You can take them home with you and try cooking like a Japanese at your own home! After the workshop, we can cook and eat some Japanese recipes using Miso. Some traditional, some creative ones – the important thing is for you to be able to make use of Miso after returning home. Please note that it takes up to a whole year for miso to fully ferment, so you need to be patient. Also, this is under the Japanese weather, so depending on the weather in your country, the fermentation process may vary or may not work in the worst case. I understand that the limit of your backpack/suitcases is always quite tight – so we will only do 500 gram of Miso per person. If you would like to make more, you can add as much as you like at 500 JPY / 500 gram as the ingredient costs.
strTitle: Join a Miso making workshop & Japanese home cooking in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Saihō-ji is a Rinzai Zen Buddhist temple located in Matsuo, Nishikyō Ward, Kyoto, Japan. The temple, which is famed for its moss garden, is commonly referred to as "Koke-dera", meaning "moss temple", while the formal name is "Kōinzan Saihō-ji". The temple, primarily constructed to honor Amitabha, was first founded by Gyōki and was later restored by Musō Soseki. In 1994, Saihō-ji was registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, as part of the "Historic Monuments of Ancient Kyoto". Until 1977, Saihō-ji was open to admission to the general public on a walk-up basis, as with other temples. At present, while it is open to the public, a number requirements limit the number of visitors. It is said that these regulations were put into place to protect the delicate moss from the hordes of tourists that plagued the temple before 1977. They prefer for the application to arrive up to 7 working days before the intended visit; there is only one visit per day, with time varying, so time of visit cannot be specified. The fee to visit (¥3,000) is the highest in Kyoto. Visitor are given access to the grounds for 90 minutes. Before being permitted access to the garden, visitors must engage in an activity, which varies from day to day. These include zazen (sitting meditation), hand copying sutras (shakyō), and chanting sutras. One is then asked to write down one's wish, name, and address. The monks keep all the sutras in the pagoda and continue to pray for all. The most famous times to visit are either during the East Asian rainy season (in Kyoto, early June to mid-July), when the rains make the moss particularly lush, or in late autumn, when the turning leaves contrast with the moss. ※Reservation is required 2 weeks in advance. ※This tour includes reservation from the temple and interpretation of the tour.
strTitle: Tour Saihō-ji (Moss Temple), a UNESCO World Heritage Site

strIntroduction: Japanese green tea is a type of tea that has a bitter taste. Green tea is often accompanied with a traditional Japanese desert as the bitterness of the tea balances the sweetness of the confectionery. This cultural combination has been enjoyed in Japan for over 1000 years, and closely relates to the preparation ceremony heavily influenced by Zen Buddhism. Come and experience the joy of this traditional duo in a Japanese tea room. Surprise your taste buds with a burst of sweetness to a surge of bitterness. (Fee includes Japanese tea and sweets)
strTitle: Enjoy Traditional Tea and Japanese Sweets in Ginza, Japan

strIntroduction: Before people started using convenient knives, people used to use small "kogatana" knives to cut things in Japan. Kogatana are small utility knives mounted in a small handle and tucked into the side pocket of many sword scabbards. They belong to the traditional Japanese swords from the samurai era. Usually they are polished on one side and have a sharpened edge on the other. You can make your own small knife called “kogatana” at this genuine swordsmith's in Tokyo. It will surely be an amazing experience! You will experience the steps of making knives from the beginning. The whole program is about 7 hours but it’s worth it. Lunch break and tea time is included (the cost of lunch is not included in the price) After the experience, your knife will be sharpened by a professional and delivered to you with its case (it will take about 3 to 4 months, please pay for delivery on the day of the experience). Your "kogatana" knife will be the only one in the world and become a treasure for you and your family as well! This is a unique and authentic experience in a genuine Japanese blacksmith studio. Learn professional skills from a real master!
strTitle: Become a swordsmith in Tokyo and make a samurai knife!

strIntroduction: What is takoyaki? Takoyaki is a fried octopus ball, which is a “must eat" food when you visit Osaka. In this activity we’ll teach you everything about takoyaki! You will learn about takoyaki and our konamon (flour food) culture through a fun and entertaining quiz game. 2. We'll teach you how to make our traditional takoyaki batter. 3. You'll learn how to make takoyaki, which is the most exciting part of the workshop! The most important thing is how to make a beautiful round-shaped takoyaki. You can make 1 of the 4 flavors of the takoyaki flavors of our store. 4. You can taste the takoyaki you make. 5. You’ll get a qualification as a takoyaki master with our recipe and a takoyaki machine as a present! This activity is available according to the following schedule: Weekdays: 18:00 - 23:00 Saturdays and holidays: 11:30 - 23:00 Sundays: 14:00 - 23:00 Become a takoyaki master during your trip in Osaka!
strTitle: Become a Takoyaki Master and Make the Specialty of Osaka!
