strTitle: See a dance performance at Black Swan Lake in Kabukicho!

strIntroduction: I’m happy to report that the geisha world is alive and well in Kabukicho! Only these days it’s populated by gorgeous young guys whose job it is to entertain women like the princesses we wish we were. What is a Host club and Kabukicho? - Host clubs offer the possibility to spend time with a professional, a so-called "host". These "hosts" work in "host clubs", and their purpose is to entertain the female guests and make them feel special. Hosts are really good at making conversation, but they’re even better at listening. They are masters at making you feel like you are the most interesting, attractive woman in the world. They’re masters at creating an atmosphere of friendship/flirtation. Usually they sit across the table and talk, but occasionally one will sit next to you instead and you’ll learn the meaning of the Japanese word “doki doki”! - Shinjuku Kabukicho Glowing with neon lights every night, Shinjuku Kabukicho is known as the city that never sleeps. Located in the Shinjuku area, Kabukicho is Japan's largest entertainment district. There are many restaurants, amusement facilities and movie theaters. Also Kabukicho is the largest red-light district in Japan, without the official red-light prostitutes. But it has a very different atmosphere compared to red-light districts in Europe. Your guide book might say Shinjuku Kabukicho and the Host club area are not safe areas, and usually travel agencies don't do guides here. But these areas have a very special and unique atmosphere and it's a much safer place now than it once used to be. ●Tour days and time: Monday to Friday Starting time is 6:30 pm or 7:00pm ●Meeting point: JR Shinjuku station, East exit, outside tickets gate, NEWDAYS SHOP. If you are coming by walking, go to JR Shinjuku station, East gate entrance. You will see Police box, KOBAN next to East gate entrance. Go down to the stairs in the entrance. Then you will see the NEWDAYS Shop. ●The duration of this tour 2 hours ●Cost inclusions: Included only guide fee. Host club fee, drinks and food are NOT included. Please pay for host's meals and host club fee during the tour. Host club fee depends on the club. It is about 5000 JPY. If you have any questions or would like further information for my tours, please send a message. ★You need to have your ID card with you★ The club have to check if the guests are older than 20 years old. If you are under 19 years old you cannot go to host clubs.
strTitle: Visit a Host Club in Shinjuku: Lady's night life with locals

strIntroduction: Have you always wanted to meet a Geisha, the traditional Japanese entertainer? Do you want to experience something MORE special than just a normal Geisha performance? Here is a chance to have dinner with a Geiko, a top-level geisha! The name “Geiko ”is only given to those who display the highest quality performance out of all the Geishas. This activity will have you meet these high-quality Geishas, where they will dance and serve you at an “enkai” (Japanese name for party). It is very rare to be able to get an opportunity to meet a top-level geisha, even for local Japanese people. Only Voyagin provides this special opportunity to have a dinner with them! Join this experience and take away an unforgettable memory. In this activity you will: • Enjoy a delicious Japanese meal at an established, highly rated Japanese restaurant • Receive drinks and meal service from a beautiful Geiko, one of the best Geishas among all Geishas • Enjoy a traditional and elegant Geisha dance performed by the Geiko. Don’t miss this once-in-a-lifetime experience with a Geiko!
strTitle: Dinner with a Top Level Geisha Performance in Kagurazaka

strIntroduction: In this experience you'll learn the art of traditional Japanese acupuncture and moxibustion. You'll leave knowing how to rejuvenate both your mind and body! After been the center of Japan's medical practice during the Edo period, acupuncture as a practice died out until being re-evaluated recently. It has the ability to enhance one's immunity by increasing one's body's resistance to diseases. In addition, moxibustion also detoxes the body and has anti-aging effects. Many people who have undergone moxibustion are able to retain their young, beautiful skin and continue to get treatment often. There was a moxibustion scene in The Last Samurai and even Steve Jobs got a moxibustion treatment! In this experience, I'll explain the procedure so that you can easily replicate it at home. This can either be done at your house or hotel. Your experience will consist of: - A lecture about Japanese traditional medicine - Learning the basic-approach of the shiatsu massage (which stimulates the tsubo - or pressure points - of one's body) - Learning about moxibustion (treatment stimulated by burning traditional healing herbs on your skin) Learn and master acupuncture and moxibustion with me. Let's start anti-aging!
strTitle: Learn Traditional Japanese Acupuncture

strIntroduction: Ninjas have always been shrouded in mystery. Their missions are top secret and they inspire the imagination of people of all ages! They are in story books, animation, movies and now in this unique restaurant! "Ninja Kyoto Restaurant & Labyrinth" is a mysterious entertainment restaurant where the Ninja's "secret hospitality techniques" are recreated in the present day. You can have lunch or dinner while enjoying the exciting Ninja show! The show is magical and maps amazing images using 8 projectors. Fight scenes are directed by Tetsuro Shimaguchi, the choreographer of the famous Kill Bill Vol.1 fight scenes. Look forward to fire performances, dynamic acrobatic movements, swordplay and wire work, just like in the movies! This is truly authentic Ninja entertainment with an extraordinary cast of performers and staff. After enjoying your meal and the show, you should visit their gift shop. There are lots of must-see Ninja inspired items, such as Ninja throwing knives and sickles. Also, the shop provides a wide selection of Sengoku warlord items! A Ninja fan's dream and should not be missed! *Opening hours: Dining Theater Ninja (Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays only) Lunch plan: Enter the restaurant at 12:00 pm. Enjoy the "Shinobi no Sato" set meal with 1 drink at the restaurant. The show starts at 13:00 pm in the theater space on the 1st floor. The show lasts 30 minutes. About the "Shinobi no Sato" lunch set meal: - Today's Appetizers - Your choice of main dish ・Grilled chicken ・Roasted pork with greens ・Grilled salmon with saikyo miso - Udon - Dessert Vegetarian dishes are also available. Please tell us in advance. Dinner plan: Enter the restaurant at 19:00 pm. Enjoy the "Juubei" set meal with 1 drink at the restaurant. The show starts at 20:00 pm in the theater space on the 1st floor. The show lasts 30 minutes. About the "Juubei" dinner set meal: - Shuriken star-blades grissini with cream pate de foie gras dip - Cold shrimp chile soup - Ninja style black deep fried chicken - White fish and tomato ceviche - Please choose one main dish ・Black enchantment ~sweet and sour tender pork~ ・Grilled salmon with saikyo miso - Today's NINJA roll sushi - Today's sweets Vegetarian dishes are also available. Please tell us in advance.
strTitle: Enjoy the ninja experience at the Ninja Restaurant, Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Wearing traditional costumes, such as kimono or yukata, while strolling historical and picturesque streets has become a trend when sightseeing in Kyoto. It is an authentic cultural experience that will unexpectedly leave you with many beautiful photos and memories not easily forgotten. Yumeyakata is one of the biggest kimono rental shops in Kyoto. We provide kimonos for rent not only for ladies but also for men and children so that the whole family can enjoy the experience together. We can provide all the items you need to wear kimono, so just bring yourself! This kimono rental package includes the kimono itself, the sash belt (obi), the Japanese clutch, the Japanese sandals, and the Japanese socks. Still worry about the hair accessories? We also provide it for sale, and the price start from 900 JPY. Wear our kimono and make a lot of beautiful memories in Kyoto.

While enjoying a relaxing holiday on a cruise, the least thing you wanna do when you disembark at Yokohama port is to find out what train route to take or get lost in Japan's complicated railway system. strIntroduction: Tsukiji Market is the biggest and most famous seafood market in the world. Tsukiji Market is basically divided into 2 areas - the Inside and the Outside market. The Inside market is mainly for professionals (such as chefs and wholesalers), while the outside market is mainly for consumers. We will explore the whole market (both Inside and Outside market) with an English-speaking guide. The detailed itinerary is below: 9:00 am - Meet at the Main entrance of Tsukiji market 9:10 am - Visit Namiyoke shrine and the Outside Market 10:00 am - Explore the Inside Fish Market 10:45 am - Fruits and vegetable market 11:00 am - End of the tour
strTitle: Visit Tokyo's Tsukiji Market on a Private Tour

strIntroduction: Asakusa is one of the oldest towns in Tokyo and has flourished since the founding of Sensoji Temple in 628 AD. The temple is located at the center of the town and is surrounded by many traditional downtown streets and areas. Our rickshaws mainly travel around the surrounding downtown areas, and we introduce guests to the history of the town, buildings, shops, and restaurants, as well as to other fun facts. Our drivers will take many photos of you along the way so be sure to bring your camera! History of rickshaws: Now rickshaws are used for sightseeing, but originally they were the main form of transportation in Japan. Invented in Tokyo over 150 years ago, rickshaws are still used in many parts of the world for transportation. Ebisuya rickshaws are all handmade and mostly come from the Hida-Takayama area in Gifu prefecture. The design has changed little from their original invention, and riding on our gorgeous red seats, you can still feel the same wind in your hair as those who rode rickshaws 150 years ago. About our drivers: Enjoy your rickshaw ride in style and comfort with our professionally-trained drivers, called “shafu” in Japanese. Each “shafu” goes through an extensive training program focused on safety, hospitality, and of course the history and culture of the town and Japan. At first sight a rickshaw may look just like a hand-pulled taxi but our service is really about making memories. There is no better way to get to know a town or move around in comfort. We can learn fun facts about the history of each town and see the ins and outs of small streets for an amazing experience. We look forward to meeting you and joining us for not only sight ”seeing” but also sight "feeling"! 30 minutes course This is the high light course of the down town area of Asakusa. The tour goes seeing around the temple such as “Rokku” old entertainment area with some Izakaya-Bar street, and shopping area for some traditional crafts or many Kimono shopps etc. We can come back to the departure point or drop-off at the temple is also available. 60 minutes This is very popular course seeing around most of the recommendable places from busy places such as “Rokku” and Hanayashiki amusement park, to the quiet places like Geisha area or Matsuchiyama, the oldest temple in this area. 90 minutes In this course you can see those places written above, plus you can practice a pray in the famous shrine for happy encounters with the Gods of happy fortune cats. On the way back you can enjoy a great view of Tokyo Sky Tree at the riverside of Sumidagawa. 120 minutes If you would like to complete all attractions of this town, no doubt choosing this course will leave you fully satisfied with Asakusa town tour. About this tour: - The tour is available even on rainy days (except during typhoons, earthquakes, etc). The rickshaws will be covered to protect you from the rain. - A maximum of 2 adults per rickshaw. Up to 2 children, 6 years old and under, can ride with 2 adults (children have to ride on the adult's lap). - Adult pricing applies to visitors ages 7 years old and older. - Wheelchair and stroller-friendly rickshaws are available. - This tour can be customized depending on your interests. - You can enjoy the tour anytime between 9:30am to 5:30pm on the day of reservation. Please let us know your preferred starting time with a message when you book. - The tours will run until 6:00pm between May to August. - You can choose between 30-minute, 60-minute, 90-minute, and 120-minute tours.
strTitle: Enjoy a historical rickshaw tour in Asakusa with Ebisuya!

strIntroduction: In Japan, the affectionate, respectful and amusing Akita dog is best known by the true story of Hachiko in the 1920s. Hachiko's owner, a professor, returned from work each day at 3 pm, and his devoted dog met him daily at the train station in Shibuya, Tokyo. Then one day, the professor dies unexpectedly. Loyal Hachiko continued to wait around for 9 years at the station for his master. Richard Gere stars in Hollywood's version of the story, "Hachi: A Dog's Tale." A male Akita dog that awaits you at the diner is 12 year-old Hayate. He is one of the proud Akita dogs from the best reputable breeder, Shirai. In his youth, he won many awards at competitions, starred on TV and in magazines. He even became a model for Hachi books. Hayate's father Kasuga went abroad to France 11 years ago and became a favorite dog of the French top breeder, needless to say there must be many step brothers and sisters of Hayate in Europe. Hayate is currently helping his beloved owner Mickey as a co-host of the diner & bar. Repeating customers say that there is some spiritual significance attached to Hayate and that they can have therapeutic experience at this place. Here you can enjoy a light meal which includes a Japanese beef hamburger patty, a salad, soup and rice, or a casual green tea time with Japanese traditional confectionery. As a bonus, you can wear a Japanese yukata (light kimono) and have photos of you taken by the staff. This activity is available every day for 1.5-hour visits.
strTitle: Dine or Drink with the Affectionate Akita Dog in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Tokyo has thousands of good locations for photo shootings. Based on your planning of the visit of the city, we can decide where to take photos. I support photo shootings for any occasions. If you have any special day while you visit Tokyo, I will be able to help you capturing the wonderful memory. (Please inform me the details in advance.) Equipments: Nikon Professional Cameras Delivery: Within 7 days via online storage
strTitle: Hire Your Personal Photographer in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Are you familiar with traditional Japanese outfits? Kimonos? Because kimonos in Japan are adorned with delicate decorations, they are really beautiful. Commonly they’re worn for celebrations such as New Year, but in this activity you can casually dress up in kimono and walk around the old streets of the traditional Tokyo neighbourhood Asakusa. In this activity, you’ll… ・Receive professional help from the host when dressing up in the kimono. You'll have the chance to learn about the various kimono items and the proper ways to put the outfit on. ・Take a walk in Asakusa dressed in a kimono. This will be a great opportunity to take a walk, shop, and dine with a veteran English-speaking tour guide around the symbols of Asakusa such as the Sensoji temple, and the Nakamise street famous as the paradise of Japanese souvenirs and sweets. Note: The best time to start this activity is in the morning, around 9:00-10:00 am, as Asakusa gets busier and more crowded later in the day. ・Have a professional cameraman take pictures for you during your walk. You can create wonderful memories from your trip to Tokyo. ・Take back, on request, a CD-R filled with the pictures of you in your kimono. It is highly recommended that you book the add-on option and take a CD-R with many professional photos of you dressed in kimono. Walking in Asakusa is an excellent chance to experience a glimpse of traditional Japanese culture. When you take a walk around the old neighbourhood, why not do it dressed up in a traditional kimono? It’ll be a fantastic experience and an unforgettable memory! *Although all times are available for booking, we highly recommend that you request starting from 9:00am or 10:00am. The streets of Asakusa can get too crowded in the afternoon for nice pictures.
strTitle: Walk the Streets of Asakusa in a Kimono

strIntroduction: Tired of typical touristic style of travel? Like to feel local vibes? This tour will show you several good-quality inspirational spots where local creative class people gather. Following a meet-up either at your hotel or in the area of visit, we will go to Daikanyama T-site to see a great selection of books, magazine, music, stationary and movies. After getting some initial inspiration, you will experience Japanese original coffee style "Kissaten" at Sarugaku Coffee, a hidden coffee shop once ranked as #1 coffee spot in Tokyo. Then, you will have art experience at the Museum of Contemporary Art Tokyo where you can see some edgy exhibitions. Have another coffee break at one of the representative of third-wave coffee movement in Tokyo. This time have a quality coffee in a traditional Japanese house. Finally, wrap up your day with hip restaurants and bars in Ebisu or Nakameguro. Please note that there are alternatives for each spots. If you would like to visit, for example, a different coffee shop, I can guide you to another place. Feel free to consult me about customizing this tour.
strTitle: Explore Tokyo's Creative Spots guided by a Creative Director

strIntroduction: You can enjoy Japanese calligraphy experience. We will give you a small lecture on how to use calligraphy tools and how to write Japanese words with those tools. strIntroduction: This is a customized tour, and I can take you around anywhere within Nagoya. If you don't know much about the area, below is a model course that I usually do, so please take a look! strIntroduction: Yabusame, one of the most divine martial arts in Japan, consists of shooting arrows at different targets while riding a running horse. It is a traditional ritual designed to please the gods of fertility, and it has been handed down as a cultural tradition for about one thousand years. Learn Yabusame in this activity held in Ibaraki, about 2 hours from downtown Tokyo and great for a day trip! The professional instructors of our famous riding club will teach you all the basics. During the first hour, basic archery like using a bow and arrow is taught. Afterwards, you intensify what you practiced on the ground in the previous hour, riding on a horse! Yabusame will take you back to a former period of Japan! It will be an unique and energetic experience. Please note: Guide interpreters are required for non-Japanese speakers. It is not easy for inexperienced people to learn Yabusame. Complete beginners will begin with horseback riding practice. When they are ready, they will progress to archery practice. Please listen carefully and do as our instructors tell you as you might get injured or hurt someone else. ※The activity is held after 15:00.
strTitle: Japanese Traditional Mounted Archery Yabusame
Explore Asakusa & Tsukiji Fish Market in This Private Tour!

strIntroduction: In this activity you will go to a special maid cafe in Akihabara where you will play Texas Holdem Poker with the local maids. strIntroduction: Karate is a form of Japanese martial arts focusing on the power of one's own body without the use of weapons and protective gear. Karate is not only a great form of exercise, but is also a good form of stress relief and becoming popular amongst women. In this lesson you'll be able to learn basic Karate techniques as well as experience the cultural practices surrounding the art form. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to wear a real karate uniform that you can purchase and take home after the lesson if you desire. - Experience the formal culture, rituals, and rules surrounding Karate- including lesson opening and closing formalities. - Receive a live demonstration from Karate masters. - Learn warm-ups used to prepare one's body properly for Karate. - Become familiar with the technique for basic kicks and punches. - Perform pair exercises to practice, reinforce, and hone learned techniques.
strTitle: Take Karate Lessons from a Black Belt Master

strIntroduction: Arashiyama is a scenic spot in Kyoto where the cultural flavors and colors of the ancient royal court have been preserved. Take a moment to walk through the noted Tenryuji Temple, listen to the rustle of the bamboo leaves and cross the Togetsukyo Bridge, over the Oi River. Wander around the sites and in the shoes of the ancient people. Our government-licensed tour guides will show you around with warm hospitality and total dedication. Since this is a private tour, your guide will take care of you from the beginning till the end. The starting time of the tour is flexible, but it's recommended to start either between 9:00-10:00 in the morning or around 13:00 in the afternoon. Okochi Mountain Villa ↓ Nonomiya Shrine ↓ Tenryuji Temple ↓ Togetsukyo Bridge ↓ End of tour (Tour guide will assist you how to get to the subway station or the nearby bus stop for your next visiting spot or your hotel) == Okochi Mountain Villa == Okochi Mountain Villa is the villa and garden of samurai film star Denjiro Okochi (1898-1962). The grounds of the villa, located on the slopes of Mt. Ogura, are a traditional Japanese strolling garden that includes a garden, tea houses and shrines. The garden is vast and has a sense of elegance and austere simplicity. Okochi was a well-known pious Buddhist who built the Jibutsudo, a Zen meditation hall. It was said that Okochi wanted to create the perfect garden with everlasting beauty to contrast with beauty captured on film that deteriorates over time. Do you think he felt the end result was perfect? When you aim for perfection, you discover it's a moving target. ～George Fisher == Nonomiya Shrine == Nonomiya Shrine is a Shinto shrine where, in ancient times, unmarried imperial princesses stayed for a year or more to purify themselves afterwhich they were sent to Ise Shrine in Mie prefecture to serve as a representative of the Imperial family. The shrine famously appears in the tenth chapter of the Tale of Genji, a classic work of Japanese literature from the eleventh century and the world's first novel. The black torii (gate) at the entrance of the shrine is an example of the earliest style of torii - unlike later versions, the bark is exposed. It has become a popular destination for young singles who come to pray for marriage. == Tenryuji Temple == Tenryuji Temple, the head quarters of the Rinzai school of Zen Buddhism, is the top-ranked among Kyoto's Five ZenTemples. The shogun Ashikaga Takauji built the temple in 1339 to comfort the spirit of the late Emperor Godaigo who passed away on Mt. Yoshino in Nara prefecture. This temple's garden, designed by the priest Muso Soseki, became the model for all later gardens that incorporate nature as a backdrop for their designs. It features a circular promenade around Sogen Pond, allowing visitors to enjoy the scenery of the garden from a variety of vantage points. == Togetsukyo Bridge == The name "Togetsukyo",meaning "Moon Crossing Over the Bridge", comes from a description of the bridge written by Emperor Kameyama in the 14th century. He wrote that , as the moon traverses the sky , it appears as if the moon is crossing over the bridge. Visitors are enchanted by the picture perfect scenery of the cherry blossoms in spring or the colorful changing leaves in autumn. Togetsukyo Bridge crosses the Oi River, well-known for its beautiful reflection of nearby Arashiyama.. There are popular boat rides around the bridge., and at night you can also witness traditional cormorant fishing, in which retrieves fish from the throats of cormorants.
strTitle: Join Kyoto Arashiyama Bamboo and Tenryu-ji Private Tour

strIntroduction: This course highlights two UNESCO Cultural Heritage sites: Itsukushima Shinto Shrine, seemingly floating in the sea during high tide and Hiroshima Peace memorial (Genbaku Dome), a constant reminder of the terrible atomic bomb attack. You will take the Shinkansen bullet train to Hiroshima Station where our government-licensed guides will meet you and take you to Miyajima and the Peace Memorial Park. At the end of the tour you will return to Osaka or Kyoto by Shinkansen. 7:30 Meet your guide at Kyoto or Shin-Osaka station. Take the Shinkansen bullet train from Kyoto or Shin-Osaka to Hiroshima. ↓ Miyajima ↓ Itsukushima Shrine ↓ Atomic-Bomb Dome ↓ Peace Memorial Museum ↓ End of tour in Osaka or Kyoto after taking the return Shinkansen bullet train (Tour guide will assist you how to get to the subway station or the nearby bus stop for your next visiting spot or your hotel.) Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/agustinrafaelreyes/6708266103/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/nam2_7676/8058759143/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/cyber0515/5451030994/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/victor_lee/7428093854/in/photostream/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/xile/53781614/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/throgers/6823843830/
strTitle: Day trip to Hiroshima from Osaka/Kyoto, guide & bullet train

strIntroduction: "Take a thrilling ride down Fuji River (Fujikawa) on this half day rafting tour! We will start at Hatakeyama and end at Hourai-bashi (Horai Bridge). Total length: 6km long, Estimated time: 3.5 hours There are 2 session for this half day rafting tour: Morning (9:00), and Afternoon (13:30) From around October, there will be 1 half-day rafting tour held each day, beginning at 10:00 am. Location: Fujinomiya City, Shizuoka (Fuji River---Shiba River) Meeting place: River Base. (You will get more details after the booking is confirmed) ~ITINERARY~ 9:00 （13:30）Registration and briefing 9:20 （13:50）Change clothes for rafting 9:35 （13:35）Move to start point 9:40 （14:00）Check safety equipments 9:45 （14:15）Instruction about how to row, how not to fall, & what to do if you fall into the river 10:00 （14:30）Rafting Tour begin! 11:00 （15:30）Raft through the 6km course of a very dynamic river! You can also enjoy body rafting and cliff jumping into the river! 12:00 （16:30）Goal! High Five! 12:20 （16:50）Tour ends. Back to the base by bus.
strTitle: Enjoy Half Day Fuji River Rafting Tour near Mt.Fuji

strIntroduction: Participate in this tour to enjoy a valuable experience in Kamakura and Enoshima from Tokyo by bus! Your journey will start at Jomyo-ji Temple, which is ranked fifth among the five great temples of Kamakura. The temple had seven buildings, pagodas, and gardens in old times, but since many buildings were destroyed by fire, now we can only see just its main hall and gardens. At Jomyo-ji Temple, you can enjoy the delicious Matcha green tea before heading to Hokoku-ji Temple. Hokoku-ji Temple is a small temple located in Eastern Kamakura. The temple was founded in the early years of Muromachi period, and it was the family temple of the ruling Ashikaga Clan, and later it became the family temple of the Uesugi Clan. The temple is famous for its beautiful small bamboo grove found behind the temple's main hall, consisting over 2000 dark green bamboo stalks. After visiting Hokoku-ji Temple, you will have a Buddhist vegetarian cuisine as your lunch, for 45 minutes before heading to Kotoku-in Temple, where you will see the Great Buddha! The Great Buddha is the symbol of Kamakura and one of the most famous attractions in Japan. The Great Buddha is the property of the Kotoku-in Buddhist temple of the Jodoshu sect and visitors are often overwhelmed by its majestic appearance. With an additional fee you can access the inside of the statue offering a unique experience and allowing you to see the casting technology of the Kamakura Age. The tours final stop will take you to Enoshima, where can stroll along taking pictures and trying the local foods. The island offers various attractions such as shrine, park, observation tower and caves. You can also see the Mt. Fuji if the weather is not cloudy! The schedule for this one-day tour is as follows: -07:30- 08:30 Pickup at select Tokyo hotels as below or check-in at: 08:20 Ana Intercontinental Tokyo 07:40 Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel 08:10 Conrad Tokyo 08:15 Courtyard Marriott Ginza Tobu Hotel -09:00 Departure from Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal Matcha Green Tea Experience at Jomyo-ji Temple (30 min) Hokoku-ji Temple (20 min) Lunch Buddhist vegetarian cuisine (45 min) Kotoku-in Temple and the Great Buddha (30 min) Enoshima Sightseeing (75 min) 17:00 - 18:00 Drop-off at Ginza 17:40 - 18:40 Drop-off at Shinjuku This tour is provided by HIS, and is offered only for the year of 2017
strTitle: Discover Kamakura and Enoshima on a 1-Day Tour from Tokyo!

strIntroduction: As you walk around the city of Kamakura, you will experience the history and culture of Japan. There are many shrines and temples that hold treasures, and the atmosphere will take you back in time! Kamakura is the perfect place for you to go sightseeing! Enjoy this tour and explore the ancient city of Kamakura! 10:00 AM Depart Shinjuku Station Around 11:30, we will arrive at Hase Station. Visit Hase Dera (Hase Kannon) Hase Dera is located on top of a hill. You will see the giant statue of Kannon, the goddess of mercy, and see the amazing view of the sea. The statue of Kannon is the tallest wooden image in Japan. It has 11 heads, each with different expressions to represent Kannon's compassion for all kinds of human suffering. Visit Kamakura Daibutsu See the great buddha of Kamakura! It is a statue of Amida Buddha, which was cast in 1252. This statue is the second largest monumental Buddha in Japan. Lunch Eat lunch around Hase Station! There are many different types of food you can eat. Relax and re-energize for your trip afterwards! A. (Summer/ Spring Season)Get on the train to Yuigahama Station - Walk to Yuigahama Beach Enjoy a walk along Yuigahama beach, one of the most popular beach spots in Japan! Relax, sit on the sand and enjoy the summer weather of Japan! We will ride the train to Kamakura Station afterwards. B. (Autumn/ Winter Season) Get on the train to Kamakura Station - Visit Myohonji Temple Myohonji Temple is one of the Nichiren Buddhism temples in Japan. It is the tallest temple in Japan. Go explore the hidden treasures in this beautiful temple. After visiting Myohonji Temple, we will be moving on to other amazing places near Kamakura Station! Visit Komachi Dori Komachi Dori is a very lively street, full of many small shops! You can purchase traditional Japanese sweets for snacks and eat it as you walk along this street! There are many souvenir shops as well! Visit Tsuruoka Hachimanguu Shrine At the end of Komachi Dori, we will get to the most important shrine in Kamakura. Founded in 1063, you will walk along a wide, spacious street until you reach the shrine. The view and atmosphere of this street will take you back in time. Walk to Sasukeinari Shrine Enjoy the walk from Tsuruoka Hachimanguu Shrine to Sasukeinari Shrine. Reach the shrine by going through a nice tunnel of tori gates with red flags. Witness statues of foxes along the way! Walk back to Kamakura Station and ride back to Shinjuku Station Around 6:30 PM, we will take the train back to Shinjuku Station. We will get back to Shinjuku Station around 7:30 PM. As a famous sightseeing spot in Japan, Kamakura will offer you the experience to get in touch with the history and culture of Japan. You will be seeing many shrines, temples, and statues. Depending on the season, you will see many seasonal flowers blooming along the streets! Depending on your tour date, you may be able to attend events that are held at the shrines/temples we visit! Estimated Cost for Own Transportation and Shrine/Temple Entrance Fee -Shinjuku to Hase Station (One Way) - 1080JPY -Kamakura Daibutsu Entrance Fee - 200JPY Option 2: -Hase station to Kamakura Station - 190JPY -Myohonji Temple Entrance Fee-100JPY Photo Credits: https://flic.kr/p/o1W4VB https://flic.kr/p/mY84qH https://flic.kr/p/8E4XDP https://flic.kr/p/fBYbEt https://flic.kr/p/dxByLT
strTitle: Enjoy a 1 Day Private Tour Around Kamakura!

strIntroduction: Get the best of Tokyo in a single day! Don’t have enough time to travel around all of Tokyo? Don’t worry! This one day tour is made for people like you who would like to enjoy as much of Tokyo as possible. After completing this tour you will have visited most of Tokyo's major tourist hot spots. We can arrange the itinerary as you like. ■ ASAKUSA ■ We start with the most popular tourist area, Asakusa. Asakusa is one of the most traditional places in all of Tokyo. Walking through the ancestral Japanese atmosphere you might be surprised at how Japanese religious customs are available to anyone and how Japanese time-honored manners have matured. You’ll experience the proper way to visit the temple & shrine, how to purify yourself, how to pray, and what a Japanese fortuneteller is like. You'll also see the symbol of Japan's state-of-the-art construction, Tokyo Sky Tree. This is currently the highest tower in the world at 634 meters. ■ The West side of Tokyo ■ After a walk inside one of the most traditional areas of Tokyo, we’ll cross the city to meet the trendy young generation of Japanese in west Tokyo. Open your eyes, you might be surprised! At Shibuya, we’ll see a statue of a loyal dog named ‘Hachi’ and the famous crossing nearby. We'll continue walking around attractive shopping areas like 109, and have a lunch break. If you like to have sushi, we’ll take you to a sushi restaurant. This quite unique sushi restaurant is in Shibuya. Many tourists want to eat sushi here! In the afternoon, we’ll move to Harajuku. We’ll visit Meiji Jingu which is one of the biggest Shinto-related shrines in Japan, and hustle and bustle Takeshita Street filled with teenagers across Japan. You can enjoy this contrast between holy atmosphere and secular world. This tour’s last destination is Shinjuku. We’ll see a famous entertaining district of Kabuki-cho (no relation with old theater performance of Kabuki) and Omoide Yokocho, an area of casual taverns for Japanese business people. This west tour shows you not only old and new, but also sacred and secular aspects of Tokyo! ★★On this tour we cover★★ ■ Asakusa ・Kaminarimon gate ・Nakamise shopping street ・Sensoji temple and Asaksa shrine If you already took part in our Asakusa walking tour, we will arrange a special tour to Kappabashi instead. ■ Shibuya ・Hachiko dog statue ・Crossing ・Centergai street ・109 ・Lunch ■ Harajuku ・Meiji Jingu Shrine ・Takeshita Shopping Street（Daiso: the biggest 100Yen Shop, Purikura） ■ Shinjuku ・skyscrapers ・Omoideyokocho alley ・Kabukicho ・Don Quijote(final stop) ★★Let’s talk. “More Knowledge, More Fun”★★ ・The difference between Buddhism and Shinto ・How to pray in a Shinto way ・How Japanese subculture is like ・Japanese traditional wedding ceremony
strTitle: Private West Tokyo One Day Tour

strIntroduction: Tsukiji Market is the biggest and most famous seafood market in the world. Eating in famous sushi restaurants is nice, but it's really touristy! This eating and walking tour will let you experience Tsukiji Market like a local! You will taste various types of delicious Japanese seafood and drinks and learn about Japanese culture by walking around with a local guide. Schedule: 8:30 am: Meet your local guide at Tsukiji Honganji Temple. Walk to the market together, and tour the different areas. Stop at 6 places for food and drink. Included Food/Drinks: -Japanese omelette -Dried bonito -Fresh oyster -Sushi -Sake -Fried fish cake 12:00 pm: Finish at Tsukiji Market. The whole town is your restaurant! Let's eat and drink all around Tsukiji!!
strTitle: Tokyo Food and Drink Tour at Tsukiji Market (From 8:30am~)

strIntroduction: Samurai culture is one of the best recognized Japanese cultures in the world. In movies or shows, people get excited seeing strong men dressed in out of ordinary costumes destroy enemies as they wave Japanese swords artistically. This culture has always been the most known all the time and the influence of the Japanese video games, anime and movies help to raise its popularity nowadays. To experience such Samurai culture, Voyagin has an experience in which participants can enjoy the atmosphere of Iaido (one type of Japanese swordsmanship) and traditional Japanese manners at the same time. They will be instructed the fundamental movement from the master and later they get to see master’s technique and skills. This is not just sword fights nor sword dances, it is one of the classic Japanese swordsmanship, Iaijutsu which has over 400 years of history. This lesson is for those who want to try the orthodox swordsmanship and we will teach courteously to everyone. This time, we cut down all the cost we could remove so that people can try this experience out at a reasonable price. Note: On rainy days it is possible to use venues such as public facilities and private dojos that require extra rental fee (about 400 JPY per person, to be paid on the day). If you need rental "gi" wear, please tell me your body size in advance (it might be not possible to arrange rental wear in all cases). It will cost 2000 JPY per person (please pay on the day).
strTitle: Learn Traditional Japanese Swordsmanship in Tokyo

strIntroduction: At 6:30pm, we'll meet at Tenma Station (on the JR loop line, just one stop from Umeda), which puts us right in the middle of a very old part of Osaka. First, we'll head to neighboring Ogimachi Park, taking in the views and getting oriented. Then it's time to dive in to Tenma proper! While walking around, I'll be sure to point out lots of interesting sights. After about thirty minutes of walking around, we'll stop for our first drink and bit of food for the night, in the heart of Tenma. Food will vary by restaurant and your tastes over the course of the evening, but typical dishes include "kushi katsu" (fried food on sticks), "dote nikomi" (slow cooked beef... parts), "tonpei yaki" (a grilled pork and egg dish), and some healthier things as well -- I promise! After some time in Tenma, we'll hop on a train for the short ride to Kyobashi, where the vibe is a bit grittier, but equally fun! It's an old area, but it's by no means dangerous at all, so don't worry one bit about that. In Kyobashi, we'll walk around about 15 minutes before stopping at a "standing bar" for more food and a drink of so. A bit more exploring, and we'll stop and one final place to round out the night. Osaka is famous for its food, and you're going to see it all tonight! Your tour will take you to three different open bars that also serve food and the two neighborhoods of Tenma and Kyobashi. The cost of the tour does not include food or drinks, but does include the train ticket between the two neighborhoods. Expect food and drinks to run 3000-4000 JPY over the course of the evening, depending how much you eat and drink. If you're a big a fan of fine Japanese whisky, consider adding the "Premium Japanese whisky tasting" option at checkout. You'll get a three whisky flight (25ml/.85 oz. each) highlighting some of the recently much ballyhooed whisky of Japan, all in a cool, hidden bar off a tiny alley. The tour is limited to a maximum of four people, but is not strictly a private tour. There is a possibility that others may join your tour, but that four person limit is never exceeded. Start time is suggested to be 6pm, but it can be made a bit earlier or later by request.
strTitle: Enjoy an adventurous evening of food and drink in Osaka

strIntroduction: The ship takes you to Yokohama Bay Area with beautiful Yokohama night view. The ship cruise is famous as Yokohama Night Spots. You can spend a romantic time while having a cocktail or soft drink. Boarding Place: Pier Aka-renga, located on the back of the Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse (15 mins walk from Bashamichi Sta.No.6 Exit of Minatomirai Line) Departing Time: Jan: 18:55 Feb: 19:55 Mar: 19:55 Apr: 19:55 May: 20:30 June: 20:55 July: 20:55 Aug: 20:30 Sept: 19:55 Oct: 19:55 Nov: 18:55 Dec: 18:55
strTitle: Enjoy a Relaxing Cruise under the Night Sky

strIntroduction: Have fun with cute lovely owls in Kyoto city as a rest from your sightseeing around Japan's old capital! Spend one hour of relaxation with the adorable animals! At first, a member of the staff carefully explains the proper way to handle the owl to avoid any harm to you and the owl. Please listen attentively to their explanation so that you can enjoy an amazing time with the owls. Here is the flow of the experience: - enter the shop and hear the instructions of the staff (first 15 minutes of the experience) - spend time with the owls (for about 35 minutes) - end of the experience You'll then need to clean your hands with hand sanitizer before you can touch and pet the owls. After your time is up, you'll be able to visit the gift shop and find a unique owl-related souvenir! Other rules to observe: - only the staff can bring and take away the owls. - don't let go off the leash. - avoid touching the owls anywhere else except for their heads. - turn off the flash when taking a photo. This is definitely a rare, unique experience that you should definitely not miss while you are visiting Japan! Reserve your seat now! It is also possible to rent the entire place for 1 hour! Available for up to 20 people at once! The opening time of the cafe in Kyoto is as follows: Weekday: 12:00 - 20:00 (last entry at 19:00) Weekend: 11:00 - 20:00 (last entry at 19:00) Closed: Mondays
strTitle: Reservation for Lovely Owl Cafe "Fukuro no Mise", Kyoto

strIntroduction: In this tour to the Okutama region in West Tokyo, we will travel by train from Shinjuku for a little over one hour, and then we will enter the scenic countryside. We will first have lunch in a beautiful Japanese tofu restaurant. After lunch, we will move to a sake brewery nearby and join a guided tour with a larger group. A brewery guide will give explanations in Japanese, and I will translate them into English. The sake brewery, founded in 1702, is perhaps the most famous of ten sake producers in Tokyo Prefecture. Taking advantage of fresh spring water abundant in the mountainous area of Okutama, it continues to make various types of quality sake by capitalizing on the expertise of a brewing master. After the tour, we will move to a tasting room where we can discover different types of sake, freshly out of the brewery, for minimal prices (100 yen to 500 yen per cup). At around 5pm, we will leave to return to Shinjuku. Those who prefer to stay a bit longer to stroll by the river are free to do so. I will give you instructions on how to get back to the city. And for those who need recommendation for a place to have dinner in the city, I would be happy to help you and make a reservation.
strTitle: Enjoy a sake brewery visit and tofu kaiseki lunch in Tokyo

strIntroduction: No matter how many times you go on it, the Battleship Island will have a different face each time. On sunny days or rainy days, the island becomes a picture,anywhere you take it from. You will probably feel overwhelmed by the force emanating from the ruins! Gunkanjima is a small island located about 20 kilometers from Nagasaki Port. Until 1974, the island served as a coal mine, and more than 5000 residents called the 480 meter long, 150 meter wide island as their home, resulting in an area with the highest population density in history recorded worldwide. In July 2015 the island became a UNESCO World Cultural Heritage Site as part of the Meiji era industrial legacy. The tour takes about 3 hours in total, however different vessels and cruises are available on different days. Therefore the time schedule depends on the availability. 1) Morning vessel Meeting time: around 9:45 am (depends on the vessel) Departure time: around 10:30 am (depends on the vessel) Returning time: 13:00 pm (depends on the vessel) 2) Afternoon vessel Meeting time: around 13:00 pm (depends on the vessel) Departure time: around 13:50 pm (depends on the vessel) Returning time: 16:10 pm (depends on the vessel) You will be allowed to actually land to Gunkanjima, but there is a possibility that you won't be able to depending on the whether condition. In that case, you will land to Takashima, another island close to Gunkanjima that flourished for its coal industry. Note: There is no English-speaking guide during this tour. However, you will be provided an English brochure. Photos by: -https://flic.kr/p/6v4obc -https://flic.kr/p/6EJmLb -https://flic.kr/p/6v8zRA -https://flic.kr/p/6v8AxQ -https://flic.kr/p/6v4pLc
strTitle: Take a Trip to Gunkanjima by Ship!

strIntroduction: Special offer only for Voyagin guests! We offer this tour at the cheapest price of any other suppliers. Don't miss this chance to enjoy half day bus tour exploring some of the best tourist spots in Tokyo in half a day at a valuable price! If you are looking for an adventurous sightseeing bus tour, here it is! This bus tour covers famous sightseeing spots in Tokyo. Enjoy the traditional Japanese garden at the Imperial Palace for the start of your tour, it will take your breath away and you’ll enjoy a peaceful and carefree feeling while you are there. The Sensoji temple and Kaminari-mon gate in Asakusa are a must-see, the magnificent structure of the temple is overwhelming. You will also be able to experience the enthusiastic atmosphere of Tsukiji Fish Market on this bus tour. While you are on the bus, the excitement will be continuous. The bus will pass by Kabukicho, the National Diet, Ameyoko open-air market, Akihabara, Tokyo Skytree, Kabuki-za Theater and much more. It's absolutely amazing to visit all those sightseeing spots in just half a day! --Brief itinerary-- 8:30 Depart from the meeting point at Shinjuku (The meeting point is Shinjuku Island Tower at 8:25) 9:00-9:40 Imperial Palace East Garden Relax and feel the breeze in the greenery. 10:15-11:15 Sensoji Temple, Asakusa Explore one of the most famous temples in Japan! 12:00: Tsukiji Fish Market The tour finishes after arrival at the market and you can explore its shops freely! --Notices-- ・The minimum participant to run the tour is 1. ・A tour assistant in English and Japanese is available. ・A multilingual audio guidance in English, Spanish, Chinese, Thai and Indonesian is available. ・Itinerary order is subject to change depending on traffic and weather. ・The weather and traffic condition on the day may change the time and order of itinerary. ・If a sightseeing spot is closed, we will replace it with an alternative place.
strTitle: Enjoy Half Day Bus Tour Around Best Tourist Spots in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: This is a Samurai training course, where you will have the chance to dress up in a Samurai's costume and learn the main techniques to use a katakana, the Japanese Samurai sword. After an intense lesson of practice facing off your opponents, swaying your katana and shooting darts, you will have the chance to take pictures in a photoshoot where you can strike your best Samurai pose. Finally, you will receive an actual certificate for your training with your picture on it. This activity also includes a short tea ceremony. Don't miss the chance to learn the secrets of the Samurai and become one yourself! This is a must-try if you always liked Samurai or Ninja and for Japanese culture lovers in general. Experience Japan up close with this activity that will become the highlight of your trip. this tour is provided by HIS
strTitle: Become a Samurai and learn to use a sword in Asakusa, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Akihabara is truly a rare gem that must not be missed when visiting Japan. Initially it built its fame for extensive electronic shops but with the computer boom over 30 years ago, stores specializing in Anime goods and Manga started to develop. Now Akihabara has turned into a town overflowing with some of the most unusual and unique subcultures. This tour will give you a glimpse into the heart of Akihabara. The places the guide will bring you are the best-suited areas to fully experience the booming Akihabara cultures. These stores listed above are also places that are rarely visited by travelers – making this tour even more unique and authentic. In other words, through this activity, you can enjoy Akihabara differently than other tourists!
strTitle: A Deep Akihabara Tour

strIntroduction: Karuizawa is best known as the summer escapade of wealthy Tokyo residents. The small mountain town was developed as a resort by Western residents of Japan in the 19th century and has a strong Western flavour. You will find a great amount of Catholic churches, attractive little shops, restaurants and plenty of summer villas and loghouses hidden in the forest. A local English-speaking guide will take you on an unforgettable walk around the most scenic spots of Karuizawa's old town, which include the shopping street Karuizawa Ginza, the quiet and moss-covered summer villas district, the picturesque Kumobaike Pond known for its breath-taking autumn colours, and many more! For an additional fee you can visit also Shiraito Waterfull, a beautiful natural spot a few kilometers north of the old town. This 70-meter wide waterfall is unique with the fact that no river flows into it! This tour can be combined with a round-trip Shinkansen ticket from Tokyo Station (or Ueno Station). Karuizawa is just an hour away from Tokyo, easily accessible with the Shinkansen.
strTitle: Explore the old town of Karuizawa with a local guide

strIntroduction: - Meet up at Asakusa Asakusa is one of the most traditional places in all of Tokyo. You will experience the proper way to visit the temple and shrine! You can wish and pray for your success at temples. You will also see the new symbol of Japan, the Tokyo Sky Tree. At Asakusa, you will visit… - Kaminarimon gate - Nakamise shopping street - Sensoji temple and Asakusa shrine After that, you will take a 35-minute river cruise from Asakusa to the Japanese Traditional garden of Hamarikyu, which is a typical Japanese styled garden with a pond in center. You can see the mixture of traditional and modern parts of Tokyo which consists of beautiful seasonal flowers, a tranquil atmosphere and modern high-rised buildings. You can try and taste matcha tea with sweets if you would like at a tea house on the pond. - Move to Tsukiji fish market You can have lunch in the outer market at Tsukiji. You can enjoy fresh and delicious sushi at reasonable prices. We’ll visit another temple, Tsukiji Honganji. - Take the subway to Nijubashi, the bridge of the Imperial Palace. The professional guide will explain to you about the Japanese Imperial family. - Finish at Yurakucho area which is filled with local business men and women. You can enjoy shopping at Ginza which is a luxurious shopping area. You can also have a drink at a Yakitori alley if you would like!
strTitle: Explore The East Side of Tokyo in One Day!

strIntroduction: There are so many sightseeing spots in Tokyo that it is hard to choose where to go when you do not have much time. However, a bus tour can solve the problem. It takes you from the historical places to a fancy shopping mall. Within a limited time, you can see the many faces of Tokyo and have a fulfilled day. Itinerary: -Pick-up at select Tokyo hotels or Check-in at Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal -Departure from Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal (at 9:00) -Visit Meiji Shrine, the Shinto shrine built for the deified spirits of Emperor Meiji and Empress. The forest around the shrine was created about 100 years ago, and 100,000 trees were planted by volunteers. Located in the heart of Tokyo, yet Meiji Shrine gives habitats to many wild animals. -Drive by National Diet Building, the equivalent of a parliament building -Visit the Imperial Palace East Gardens. Edo Castle’s innermost circles of defense, Honmaru and Ninomaru used to exist there. Enjoy a stroll on a big lawn and watch Japanese style gardens with seasonal flowers. You will be amazed by the contrast between high buildings surrounding the palace and a traditional scenery. -Visit Sensoji Temple and Nakamise Shopping Street. Asakusa is a typical downtown area where you can feel an old time atmosphere of Tokyo. There are a number of shops lining in front of Sensoji Temple, which sells local treats and unique souvenirs. After enjoying shopping or trying sweet delights, head to Sensoji Temple, which is the most popular landmark in Tokyo. Do not forget to take pictures before a big red lantern of the Kaminarimon Gate! Ginza (drive through) Japanese Dance Viewing (10 min) -Enjoy lunch overlooking Hamarikyu Gardens. Eat a Western-style lunch at the restaurant in the Seaside Hotel Shiba Yayoi. You can enjoy breathtaking views of Tokyo Bay and Japanese traditional garden, Hama-rikyu. *Lunch menu is subject to change. A vegetarian option is available, please let us know when booking. -Enjoy Tokyo Bay Cruise. Get aboard a luxurious ferry, “Symphony” for a cruise around Tokyo Bay area. -Visit Aqua City Odaiba famous for its futuristic architectures and big shopping malls. -Drive across the Rainbow Bridge whose colorful lights enhance a romantic mood at night. -Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal around 17:10-17:40 (drop off available) -Tour ends upon arrival at Tokyo Station around 17:30-18:00 (Marunouchi South Exit) this tour is provided by HIS
strTitle: Panoramic Tokyo Bus Tour with Lunch and Bay Cruise

strIntroduction: In this activity you will dress in a gorgeous kimono and walk around Tokyo's Bonsai Museum, enjoying the garden and the beautiful bonsai art. You can take photos both inside the museum and in the garden. As an add-on option you can book a traditional tea ceremony too! This activity is available every day from 10:00 to 16:00. The house is located in East Tokyo, near Koiwa or Mizue stations, about 30 minutes away by train and city bus from Akihabara station.
strTitle: Wear a Kimono at a traditional house in the Bonsai Museum

strIntroduction: Maid Cafes were originally designed for male otaku, fans of anime, manga and video games. Waitresses at this coffee shop dress in maid costumes that remind animation fans of popular female characters. Everyone enjoys the make-believe atmosphere. Now Maid Cafes are loved by not only male otaku (anime or manga fans) but also by women and international tourist eager to see the exciting evolution of Japan’s modern culture. Maidreamin is located at Akihabara. It’s much like an entertainment café and bar. Once you enter Maidreamin, you’ll become almost a resident of the dream land. Waitresses treat you as ladies and gentlemen. You can also take a picture with the pretty waitresses dressing in costume. Let’s enjoy! It should be one of your special memories in Japan. Open hours Monday to Friday: 11:30 - 23:00 Weekends and Public Holidays: 10:30 - 23:00 Choose between several food options: ※Price※ Plan A: 1 hour Drink combo (1Drink + Commemorative photo) 1500yen Plan B: 1 hour Food combo (Omeletrice or Curryrice or Hamburg steak or Parfait or Cake + 1Drink + Commemorative photo+Souvenir) 2500yen Plan C: 2 hours Food combo (Omeletrice or Curryrice or Hamburg steak or Parfait or Cake + 1Drink + Commemorative photo+Souvenir+Maid Live) 3500yen
strTitle: Enjoy Maid Cafe Maidreamin in Akihabara
